job description:
About the job
Vicomtech (www.vicomtech.org) is a private Applied Research Center specialized in Artificial Intelligence, Visual Computing and Interaction located in Donostia-San Sebastian and Bilbao (Spain). Vicomtech is a member of the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA) and GraphicsVision.ai, an international network specialized in Computer Graphics (https://graphicsvision.ai/). Vicomtech is looking for an Internet of Things researcher to join our Connected, Cooperative and Automated System department.

Along with artificial intelligence (AI) and big data, the Internet of Things (IoT) is at the centre of the digitisation of the world economy. With devices becoming ever smarter in collecting data, processing and transmitting information, and triggering actions in real-time, the IoT is at the heart of this digital transformation, integrating devices, data, computing power and connectivity.

We are looking for a candidate that will work on automotive-related research projects. The automotive industry has arrived at an inflexion point: a shift towards autonomous, connected, electric and smart technologies. This shift promises to disrupt markets while improving efficiency and sustainability of transportation of people and goods.

Applicants must have:
A master's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications Engineering, or a related field.
Experience with Python or C/C++.
Experience with Cloud or Edge applications.
High level of English.
We offer:
Joining a young multidisciplinary team of researchers and professionals with high technological specialization.
Attractive national and international research and development projects with cutting-edge technology.
Possibility of pursuing a PhD.
Personal development through training and educational opportunities.
Career opportunities and professional progression.
Work-life balance policies to achieve a balance between work and family life.
Equal employment opportunities.
If you feel identified with us, please send us your CV

job description:
About the job
About Vermut

Vermut is a community marketplace of unique experiences for seniors. The market is huge and no-one is paying attention to create an overall solution for the pains and desires of our older adults. We are building ‘the place to be for seniors’. The company was set up at the end of 2020, and we’ve already proven market fit in Spain and we are planning to double down to Spain and Europe, scaling fast and building from the bottom-up.

The Data team is responsible for building the environment that enables data-driven decision-making and progress measuring. You will be impacting how the whole company executes thanks to your insights. The data team is small and the opportunity to learn and grow from it is huge. If you like to see how working with data impacts the day to day of a company, this position should move you.

Ownership

Build all the company dashboards, and maintain the connections and the logic behind the current ones (Build and maintain data pipelines from DB to dashboards and reports)
Build the structure of data flows between platforms and own the relationship with the Engineering team.
Build correlations and draw conclusions based on analysis (ex. customer retention, demand planning).
Help scale the Ops, Marketing, and Sales teams with processes and projects on-demand.
Help the CEO and Finance team with scaling the financial forecasting.

What we are looking for

Degree in Engineering, Maths, Data or similar
Highly data driven and analytical mindset
Problem-solving skills and execution focus
Comfortable working with high-intensity environments
Technical skills
SQL knowledge
DataStudio or other visualization tool knowledge
Understand our values and be able to embrace them:
- Passion for what you do. Dedication and commitment to excel at your job.
- User first. Empathy towards covering their needs and creating value.
- Constant feedback. Honest and proper constructive criticism is what makes us innovate fast as a company.
- We are still humans. Your health and peace is important in order to shine at your job, do not forget.

Benefits

International and smart team.
Blank sheet to create and build from scratch.
Monthly gatherings and optimistic company culture.
Free Vermut activities.
Hybrid work culture (but with preference in on-site working - Barcelona, Spain)
skills: Análisis de datos, Analítica de datos, Capacidad de análisis, Analítica, and SQL

job description:
About the job
Vicomtech (www.vicomtech.org) is a private Applied Research Center specialized in Artificial Intelligence, Visual Computing and Interaction located in Bilbao (Spain). Vicomtech is a member of the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA) and GraphicsVision.ai, an international network specialized in Computer Graphics (https://graphicsvision.ai/). Formed by more than 200 researchers -more than 60 are PhDs- in various technologies and application areas and more than 80 scientific publications per year, Vicomtech fosters the use of the latest cutting-edge technologies in applications that support the innovation cycle in companies and organizations in our environment, including those in the intelligent security video analytics sector.

Vicomtech has a strong activity in applying machine learning and & AI in industry. By following the paradigm of Industry 4.0, research activities are oriented to improve industrial processes through R&D on Data Analytics and Machine Learning.

In the Data Intelligence for Energy and Industrial Processes department we research new applications based on data analysis and visualization and Industry 4.0 technologies to transfer them to the business network and strengthen its competitiveness.

We are looking for people with an interest in research to help us in the design, development and deployment of applications, based on cutting-edge technologies and good software development practices.

We are interested in people with previous experience as well as in people who know the working technologies and have interest in testing and/or developing a research career. A desire to pursue a PhD or have a PhD would be a plus.

The selected person will join a team competent in the entire technology stack of Industry 4.0 applications. You will work in the research team supporting the design and development of application technologies (connectivity, storage, analysis, visualization, Web interaction, deployment...), according to the quality, robustness and security standards set by the center and customers.

Candidates must have:

● Bachelor's/Master's degree Computer Science, Telecommunications, Machine Learning or similar
● Understanding of Machine Learning methods, Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement Learning
● Knowledge of programming technologies in some of these areas: Python ecosystem for ML and optimization, databases
● Very good communication skills and ability for business translation between customer and R&D team.
● A medium-high level of English and Spanish
We value that candidates have:
● A desire to pursue a PhD or have a PhD would be a plus.
● System architecture knowledge: Full-stack, virtualization & cloud, containers (Docker/Docker compose, Kubernetes),...
● A medium-high level of Basque is desirable.
● Interest in developing a research career, having a PhD or having interest in completing it at Vicomtech.

We offer:

● Joining a dynamic, innovative and leading center in the field of Artificial Intelligence and Visual Computing & Interaction at international level with work centers in Donostia - San Sebastian and Bilbao.
● Opportunity to contribute to attractive projects with a high impact on industry using innovative technologies.
● Creative freedom to implement solutions that respond to the needs of the center.
● Personal development through training and educational opportunities.
● Career opportunities and professional progression.
● Work-life balance policies to achieve a balance between work and family life.
● Equal employment opportunities.

If you feel identified with us, please send us your CV

job description:
About the job
Desde Manpower buscamos Logistic Data Analyst para trabajar con uno de nuestros clientes más importantes ubicado en VACARISSES y dedicado al sector de los aires acondicionados a nivel industrial.

Darás apoyo al equipo logístico europeo aportando los conocimientos pertinentes para ayudarles a gestionar el control de costes y alcanzar los objetivos.

Funciones
Ser responsable de los informes de control de costes analíticos y de resultados
Comprender y analizar la información detectando discrepancias
Asumir la responsabilidad del recorrido y los procesos de las facturas de principio a fin, desde la recepción de la factura, la introducción en el sistema por parte del equipo contable, la creación/elevación de la orden de compra correspondiente, los problemas relacionados, el pago puntual, etc.
Estrecha colaboración con todas las áreas de nuestra empresa y con las partes interesadas externas en sus necesidades. Actuar como enlace con proveedores, agentes en origen y destino, almacenes, compradores y servicio de atención al cliente, para garantizar un flujo de información fluido.
Llevar a cabo análisis en profundidad y oportunidades de mejora, promoviendo planes de acción para los proveedores y las partes interesadas
Cumplimiento y vigilancia de la política financiera con los proveedores
Comunicación de temas complejos de forma accesible

Condiciones
Contrato de entrada temporal (máx. 1 año) con posibilidades de incorporación a plantilla posteriores.
Salario competitivo en función experiencia aportada
Horario central de lunes a viernes con entrada y salida flexible y viernes hasta las 14h.

Requisitos
Estudios universitarios
Inglés y español fluidos
Excel avanzado (Microsoft Office)
Al menos 5 años de experiencia como Analista de Datos Logísticos
Experiencia desarrollando modelos analíticos y reportando resultados
Capacidad de resolución de problemas, cómodo trabajando con datos para realizar análisis
Buenas aptitudes para comunicarse eficazmente con las partes interesadas
Capaz de demostrar experiencia trabajando en equipos remotos / centralizados

job description:
About the job
¿Quién somos?
duagon Iberia, a rapidly expanding Swiss technology company, is a leading supplier for communication, computing and control technology as well as project planning and development services for system critical applications in the rail, medical and critical automation market. The superior software and hardware IP creates innovative, highly reliable and safe products, enabling customers to shape and realize their technology roadmap. Moreover, customers benefit from a shorter time to market and lower total cost of ownership.

Funciones:
Implementación de procesos ETL y ELT desde un Data Warehouse Oracle y logs en XML y JSON a Datalake en HDFS, Hive y HBase.
Modelos predictivos de venta, upselling, downselling, cross-selling y fuga de
Diferentes productos bancarios con Spark y R, aplicando inteligencia artificial.
Análisis de datos de los diferentes productos financieros existentes en el mercado

Requisitos:
Experiencia previa de al menos 2 años en banca como data analyst.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas Big Data, SQL, BBDD No SQL, Spark, Kafka, R y Python para la elaboración de ETL.

Conocimientos valorables:
Conocimiento de lenguajes de programación: SQL, R, Python y Spark.
Conocimiento de herramientas de big Data: Spark, Hive, Real Time (Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.).
Curiosidad para analizar e interpretar datos.
Experto en el manejo de datos.
Capacidad de resolución de problemas.
Capacidad de aprendizaje.
Muy valorable el trabajo en equipo, atracción por compartir el conocimiento.
Buena expresión, oral y escrita.
Acostumbrado al trabajo auto organizado.
Con amplia orientación a los procedimientos y cumplimiento de estándares.

Titulación:
Grado en Económicas, Física, Matemáticas, Ingeniería o similar.
Valorable postgrado o especialización en Data Science, Big Data.

En duagon Iberia podrás desarrollar tu carrera en función de tus aspiraciones, crecer con nosotros y participar en nuestras interesantes iniciativas de conciliación mediante la modalidad híbrida de trabajo, formación continua y remuneración atractiva.

Si quieres saber más, visítanos en www.duagon.com

job description:
About the job
En FI Group ayudamos a pequeñas y grandes empresas a desarrollar sus ideas innovadoras a través de la obtención de incentivos fiscales y ayudas a nivel nacional e internacional.
Apostamos por la I+D+i como base para la creación de compañías más competitivas que aporten soluciones para cambiar el presente y mejorar el futuro de nuestra sociedad.

Actualmente estamos buscando para nuestro departamento de IT un "BI Developer". Te incorporarás a un equipo joven y dinámico , desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener soluciones de inteligencia de negocios.
Mantener, mejorar y optimizar los flujos y conjuntos de datos del Servicio de PowerBI.
Crear y mantener reportes e informes en PowerBI Service.
Diseñar y mantener paquetes ETL desde diferentes fuentes de información de la compañía hacía el Datawarehouse o Datamarts.
Trabajar de la mano con las distintas áreas de la compañía para diseñar y mantener la estructura de BI.
Configurar soluciones y flujos de datos entre diferentes sistemas de información de la compañía.

¿Por qué trabajar con nosotros?
Nuestro mayor valor son las personas que conforman FI Group. Simpatía, cercanía, profesionalidad y agilidad son las señas de identidad de nuestro equipo humano. El esfuerzo, el entusiasmo, la pasión y la capacidad de innovar que nos caracterizan, nos llevan a emprender proyectos motivadores que convierten nuestro día a día en un reto.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Experiencia como desarrollador de BI.
Experiencia con PowerBI Service/Premium y herramientas como Dax Studio, Tabular Editor. (Avanzado)
Conocimiento de Power Query, Languaje M, DAX. (Avanzado).
Experiencia en el modelado dimensional de datos para el desarrollo, implantación y uso de Datawarehouse o Datamarts.
Experiencia con bases de datos SQL y NoSQL.
Conocimiento de Transact-SQL (Medio).
Valorable conocimiento de SQL Server y SSIS (Integration Services).
Valorables nociones en tecnologías de sistemas de información, ERP, CRM, Apps con bases de datos relacionales. (No excluyente)
Valorable experiencia en servicios de datos de Azure (Azure SQL, Data Factory, Synapse, etc). (No excluyente)

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Queremos que estés a gusto y ser más que un trabajo para ti. Para hacerlo posible tenemos un pack de beneficios sociales adaptados a tus necesidades:

Muy buen ambiente de trabajo rodeado de personal que te ayudará a crecer profesionalmente.
Incorporación a empresa líder en su sector en constante crecimiento.
Posición internacional en contacto con otras filiales.
Tendrás jornada flexible cada día, además los viernes y en verano harás jornada intensiva.
Queremos que crezcas con nosotros y para hacértelo fácil tenemos un plan de carrera y formación diseñado para que puedas dar lo mejor de ti.
Paquete de beneficios flexible.
El buen ambiente es muy importante, así que podrás disfrutar con tus compañeros de diferentes actividades (solidarias, deportivas, etc.)

¡Te esperamos con los brazos abiertos! ¿Te apuntas?
--------
F. Iniciativas España I+D+i, S.L.U le informa que sus datos han sido incorporados a un fichero automatizado con la finalidad de avanzar en los procesos de selección. Los datos recogidos son almacenados bajo la confidencialidad y las medidas de seguridad legalmente establecidas. Igualmente deseamos informarle que podrá ejercer sus derechos a través del siguiente correo electrónico: rgpd@fi-group.com
Para conocer nuestra política de privacidad en mayor detalle pinche https://es.fi-group.com/politica-de-privacidad/

job description:
About the job
Mission
Manages and Leads Business Intelligence projects according to Business Intelligence Manager, offering innovative solutions with the objective of process optimization.
Main Accountabilities:
Analyse business processes and gather relevant requirements to propose new processes designs.
Deliver innovative and collaborative solutions for processes optimization: Processes automation and development of applications to improve processes efficiency (i.e. fast bpm tools, RPAs).
Definition and implementation of Business Intelligence solutions supporting internal clients on their business objectives and decision making processes (design of Scorecards and Dashboards, KPIs and metrics implementation…).
Support effective change management in process/tools implementation, develop communication material and provide training when required.
Administrate the infrastructure needed to successfully implement process improvement initiatives (tools, reports, modes…)
Build and facilitate reporting on process efficiency, compliance, and other key metrics.
Prepare presentations for management, conferences, and internal management meetings.
Support BPE Director in corporate initiatives, provide advisory support to other departments and perform other special projects and tasks as required.
Required profile
ACADEMIC LEVEL
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics or economics. Studies in data analytics & management will be considered.
REQUIRED PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
3-6 years of work experience in consulting, business intelligence or data analytics/science.
SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE
Proficient with relational databases (SQL).
Proficient with Excel, Word and Powerpoint.
Experienced with Power BI (ability to analyse data and prepare reports).
Familiarity with a modern programming language (R and/or C) and some prior programming experience as well as knwoledge in SAS will be an advantage.
LANGUAGES
Full proficiency in English and Spanish is required.
SKILLS / COMPETENCES
Strong analytical skills
Interpersonal and teamwork skills: ability to perform duties in a collaborative work environment
Commitment to producing high-quality work
Structured and methodical

job description:
About the job
After 12 years in the gaming industry, Tangelo Games is today a leading publisher and developer of social and casual videogames on a mission to make people’s lives better worldwide by connecting them through playing. And, thanks to our wide-ranging portfolio, the fun never stops with free to play traditional and board games on our multiplayer gaming community 'Mundigames'.

But life at Tangelo is more than games! Since it was born in 2011, Tangelo has grown to be a solid company but has kept the agility, soul, and passion of a start-up while boosting a strong corporate culture based on community, commitment, challenge, and pragmatism. Always playing as A-team.

And that's where you come in. As our next Data Analyst, you will help our Analytics team to define and develop the company analytics roadmap. As a data-centric company, you will have the opportunity to dive deep into product performance and customer behavior analysis, leveraging insights to drive growth.

Responsibilities
Work with the Product Team on providing insights about user behaviour and product performance and help on the definition of features and set goals
Join in defining the key metrics required for analyzing product features, and collaborate on the implementation of data tracking necessary
Work with Marketing Team to analyze Acquisition and Retention campaigns performance and suggest improvements
Develop statistics models to better understand our business and help company growth
Collaborate with other team members on developing data processing flows

Requirements
At least 3 years of experience as B2C Data Analyst in the gaming industry
Holds a Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or Economics)
Experience working on Gaming or Mobile apps environment
Programming skills and advanced knowledge of Python ( R a plus )
Experience with SQL
Experience on exploratory data analysis
Experience developing analytic models
Experience on reporting and presenting results
Excellent level of both English and Spanish

Extra Bonus
Knowledge of AWS database technologies: Redshift, Athena, RDS, S3
Knowledge of Tableau
Knowledge of Airflow

Soft Skills
Analytic and problem-solving skills
Methodical and meticulous
Results-oriented
Hands-on attitude
Sense of initiative and entrepreneurship
Excellent communication skills in English and Spanish
Team Player

Perks
Flexible working hours
Remote work friendly
Multicultural, friendly and talented team. Play with the best!
Training Program Budget. Keep learning!
Employee Referral Program Bonus
Optional Ticket Restaurant or Health Insurance Plan
Flexible compensation plan
Paid leave on your birthday. Celebrate wherever you want!
Team-building events
Fully equipped HQ with beer tap, ping pong, boxing set and much more!
E-Scooter & Bike parking and shower facilities in the building

job description:
About the job
Company Description

¡Hola, somos Merkle! Una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, que forma parte del grupo global de comunicación dentsu.

Ayudamos a empresas IBEX35, grandes anunciantes y compañías Fortune 500 a desarrollar experiencias de clientes únicas y personales a través de los datos, la tecnología y la creatividad.

Poseemos capacidades únicas en Customer Experience, Data Management e Intelligence Analytics. Al tiempo que incorporamos la visión estratégica a nuestro alto grado de especialización creando una manera de trabajar única con nuestros clientes.

Con sede en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, la base del liderazgo de Merkle lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por profesionales con gran pasión, ilusión y potencial en su trabajo

Job Description

En MERKLE apostamos por aquellas personas a las que les gusta salir de zona de confort, que aspiran a encontrarse y superar nuevos retos y que quieren trabajar en un ambiente amigable y donde todos somos un equipo.

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

El perfil que estamos buscando tendrá como principales funciones:

Diseñar soluciones personalizadas de medición digital según requisitos del cliente.
Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos.
Validación y seguimiento de los modelos.
Elaboración de informes/dashboards de acuerdo a necesidades del cliente.
Colaborar con ingenieros de datos, desarrolladores y analistas de negocio para la puesta en producción y evolución de los modelos desarrollados.
Impartición de formaciones en remoto y presenciales.
Rigurosidad en la aplicación del método científico y la metodología de trabajo.
Formación continua en las tecnologías y disciplinas digitales de la industria.
Soporte al cliente.

Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.
Trabajamos con clientes de primer nivel, empresas líderes en su sector con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

Fomentamos los hábitos de vida saludables y por ello tendrás seguro médico privado pagado íntegramente por la empresa.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Qualifications

Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Informática, Física, Estadística.. se valorará de forma positiva haber cursado un postgrado o master relacionado con análisis de datos o ciencia de datos.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python, R.

Seria interesante que tuvieses conocimientos acerca de los principales servicios de Google Cloud Platform, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, BigQuery..

Lo ideal es que tengas experiencia en modelos estadísticos, así como orientación al cliente y dotes comunicativas.

El nivel de inglés para nosotros es muy importante, por lo que es importante que sea alto.

Te ofrecemos:
Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Seguro médico privado
Amplio número de días de vacaciones
Horario flexible
Horario de verano (3 meses)
Posibilidad de teletrabajar
Formación continua (Linkedin Learning, Merkle University, etc)
Clases de inglés

Merkle does not discriminate against job applicants on the basis of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Experience stipulated in this job description serves as a guide only and all applications will be considered on their merits, irrespective of experience. At the point of application, the candidate must have the legal right to work in Spain as we are unable to sponsor visas at this time.
As part of our Diversity and Inclusion agenda, and as an Equal Opportunities employer, if you require reasonable adjustments during the selection process please engage directly with your Recruiter.

job description:
About the job
Únete a El Corte Inglés y participa en el proceso de transformación digital, trabajando con las tecnologías más punteras de cada sector.

Nos gustaría incorporar, formando parte del área de logística, un Data Engineer para nuestro equipo de Big Data, el cual te ayudará a continuar con tu desarrollo laboral y a conseguir tus objetivos.

Disponemos de un sistema de trabajo híbrido con horario de entrada y salida flexible. Y hablando de flexibilidad… podrás elegir cómo sacar el máximo partido a tu retribución al contratar nuestro plan flexible, que consta de seguro médico, ticket restaurante, tarjeta transporte y cheques guardería.

Buscamos una persona que disfrute:

Diseñando, desarrollando, construyendo y manteniendo la arquitectura de Big Data.
Diseñando herramientas de ETL.
Optimizando modelos de datos para su consumo final.

¿Te animas a formar parte de nuestro equipo? Nos encantaría poder contar con tu talento, por lo que...
si has trabajado con bases de datos NoSQL como MongoDB o Cassandra, conoces algún lenguaje de programación a nivel scripting (Python, Scala, Java) y tienes un nivel experto de SQL, descubre nuestra oportunidad laboral.

Además, sería genial si hubieses trabajado con alguna plataforma cloud, así como que puedas aportar conocimientos de alguna herramienta de BI.

¡Apúntate al cambio, súmate al reto!

position: Credit Data Analyst with English and Power BI - PageGroup SSC
job description:
About the job
Great opportunity to boost your career in Finance!|International Company SSC in Barcelona

About Our Client

At the heart of PageGroup's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people through creating opportunity to reach potential.

PageGroup was established in the UK in 1976. We're now a FTSE 250 organization with operations in 36 countries, providing recruitment services and career opportunities at a local regional and global level.

In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally. Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre

Job Description

Being based in our Barcelona Shared Services Centre within the Order-to-Cash department, the role supports the creation and growth of a global team in charge of credit & litigation management. The position aims to provide support to the regional credit teams through data analysis, reporting & efficiency improvement. In the first few months the role will be dedicated to support the launch/stabilization of the activities and will evolve to data-driven/reporting activity.

Support customer data collection process (optimization of the credit application)
Extract information & data from the different systems (Sales, Finance & PowerBI)
Work with the credit bureau to interpret, automate & integrate data within reporting
Ensure data accuracy & consistency to ensure correctness of credit risk & litigation reporting
Work closely with the different stakeholders (Project team, IT, Credit Managers, local finance business partner) in order to design, maintain, automate and optimize PowerBI reports
Prepare monthly, quarterly and adhoc credit & litigation report, KPIs & analysis to be reviewed by the regional credit managers
Investigate inconsistencies, answer queries from the credit managers & resolve them in collaboration with the different teams
Produce mass credit scoring to be reviewed by the credit manager
Manage credit risk alert received from credit bureau
When needed produce Market & business risk report
Participate in Finance improvement projects through supporting the implementation of new processes, tools automation and best practices.
The Successful Applicant
Administrative, data analyst degree or
Ideally prior experience in:
working in finance/O2C and shared service center environment
collaborating effectively with international team/cross-team to deliver
Good knowledge of all core MS Office applications, especially
Knowledge in powerBi will be a plus
Analytical, problem-solving mindset understanding on how to handle, resolve issues
Dynamic, organized with a methodical
Proven ability to work independently and take
Continuous improvement mindset
Outstanding attention to details and accuracy; ability to identify data are correct, complete and consistent
Excellent communication
Fluency in English is a must
What's on Offer

Experience in a multinational environment (+40 nationalities in the SSC)
Competitive compensation and benefits package in Barcelona, various well-being activity options

job description:
About the job
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Objetivos

Este puesto es un rol clave en el mantenimiento de los sistemas que soportan las operaciones de la fábrica.

El Analista de Datos Locales (LDA) crea, cambia y mantiene los datos maestros locales (GMPs y de negocio) de la planta utilizando los procesos establecidos. Como parte de ese mantenimiento de los datos están las tareas de recopilación, introducción y limpieza de los datos en los sistemas SAP (R3/APO) y PMX entre otros, según los Procedimientos operativos estándar (SOP) aprobados.

Es el responsable de mantener en los sistemas el Material Master, Estructuras (BOM´s), Recetas, Recursos (Centros de Trabajo), Matrices de Transición y los Procedimientos de Producción de empaquetado, asegurando que los datos locales sean precisos y correctos mediante procesos de verificación y auditorias periódicas.

Responsabilidades
Ejecutar la actualización de todos los datos maestros en los sistemas MES y WES de la planta de producción. Todo ello en coordinación con los Global y Local Data Analyst de otras afiliadas y los responsables de datos maestros de las diferentes áreas de la Fábrica.
Gestionar las peticiones de cambios de datos a través de las herramientas aprobadas.
Participar activamente en los lanzamientos de nuevos productos y discontinuaciones desarrollando las tareas correspondientes al Local data Analyst en los tiempos marcados.
Cumplir la ejecución de las Políticas Globales y Procedimientos locales.
Incorporar, cuando se requiera, en procedimientos locales las nuevas operativas.
Verificar periódicamente los datos en los sistemas y garantizar su exactitud y consistencia.
Proporcionar a las áreas que lo requieran todo el soporte necesario en temas de datos para la optimización de sus procesos y para la resolución de incidencias del día a día.
Participar en revisiones y actualizaciones anuales de costes y estándares en preparación para el ejercicio del Plan de Negocios.
Ejecutar y analizar mensualmente el inventario Baja Rotación.
Participar en diferentes tipos de proyectos en el ámbito local y/o global.
Mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro, trabajar de manera segura y responsable y apoyar todos los Objetivos Corporativos de Salud, Seguridad y Medio Ambiente.

Habilidades Personales
Capacidad de comunicación y de trabajo en equipo.
Capacidad de organización, priorización y atención al detalle.
Capacidad para analizar, anticipar y resolver problemas complejos (técnicos, operativos o relacionados con el negocio).

Requerimientos De Formación
Técnico Superior en Administración y Finanzas.
No se requiere experiencia.
Conocimientos en Informática a nivel de usuario.
Conocimientos Excel y otras herramientas Office. Muy valorable conocimiento en Power Apps y PowerBI.
Deseables conocimientos en SAP.
Valorable conocimientos previos de Industria Farmacéutica o afines.
Idiomas: Inglés Fluido hablado y escrito (B2).

Eli Lilly and Company, Lilly USA, LLC and our wholly owned subsidiaries (collectively “Lilly”) are committed to help individuals with disabilities to participate in the workforce and ensure equal opportunity to compete for jobs. If you require an accommodation to submit a resume for positions at Lilly, please email Lilly Human Resources ( Lilly_Recruiting_Compliance@lists.lilly.com ) for further assistance. Please note This email address is intended for use only to request an accommodation as part of the application process. Any other correspondence will not receive a response.

Lilly does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

job description:
About the job
Do you want to join an international team & develop your skills as a Power BI Developer?

If so, this is your lucky opportunity! We are looking for a Power BI Specialist to be a part of a new team, being responsible for creating meaningful reports and dashboards based on Power BI.

You will find domain technical experts that collaborate in creating challenging solutions allowing you to develop yourself and work in the top of your technical expertise.

Are you eager to join an international and fast-paced environment full of challenges and technical-growth opportunities?

How ERNI cares about YOU

📚 Paid and rewarded certifications: you will be able to learn new technologies to develop as a professional in the areas that interest you most (such as: Agile, DevOps, Cloud, QA, etc.) and be rewarded from 200€ to 1.400€ per certification, in addition to the paid exam.

🏆 High Value Training: after a year at ERNI, you will have the opportunity to enroll on +500€ Executive courses, Masters or Postgraduates. 80% of the total amount will be covered by the company.

👌 Hybrid working model: at ERNI we believe in the importance of building strong relationships with our colleagues. You can expect 5 to 6 days per month dedicated to team building and different events at the office.

🏠 Home Office: you will receive an extra monthly compensation to cover your teleworking expenses, as well as any necessary equipment to be comfortable doing your job.

🌍 Far Home Office: you can extend your holidays and work remotely from any European country or Spanish city up to 5 weeks per year.

💫 Flexible working shift*: you will enjoy a Friday intensive shift and a self-managed flexible working hours.

🤝 Permanent contract: there is always a project for you to keep working with us, you will always find a project that fits your expectations in our people allocation meetings.

🚀 Challenging projects: ERNI is dedicated to develop high-quality software in complex technical environments such as pharmaceutics, biotechnology, robotics and 4.0 industry. With us, you will have the chance to participate in a variety of technical challenging projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues.

⭐Proximity and support: from the first day at ERNI, you will be guided by a Mentor and a People Development team that will make sure you have the right tools to develop and give you opportunities to grow in a project or to switch to a new one.

👂 Communication: you will find transparency, honesty, and open communication all over the organization through a breakfast with our MD and a monthly session to be updated on what’s going on at ERNI.

🏅 Promotions & Recognition: from the very first day, we offer you a way to learn and develop yourself in our company. All efforts are always recognized and appreciated by your colleagues and superiors which makes feel satisfied with your own achievements.

💭 Free languages courses: learn German and Spanish or improve your English skills with our external teachers in small groups once per week.

🩺 Private medical insurance: we will offer you a private medical insurance for you and a 100% salary coverage on sickness leave.

💰 Flexible compensation: you will be able to dedicate part of your gross salary to different options such as transportation bonus, ticket restaurant, kindergarten bonus and to also to be able to add a family member into your own insurance plan.

🤸‍♀️ Gym Funding: ERNI bets on a healthy lifestyle, for that reason, we offer you special discounts on fitness facilities.

✔ Re-allocation funding: if you are coming from abroad, we will help to become a part of our company with a relocation package bonus from 1.000€ to 2.000€.

🤑 Referral program: you will receive an extra bonus with our “Candidate’s referral program” from 2.000€ to 6.000€ depending on the candidate seniority level; and an extra bonus, also with our “Business opportunity referral program” from 500€ to 5.000€ depending on the opportunity size and customer.

🕵️‍♂️ Life support: to strengthen our commitment to conciliation and willingness of being close in your day-to-day life and important moments. We provide you a set of services and benefits, free of charge for, to assist you and your family in legal consultation, personal assistance, etc.

💃 Events: we do believe in the importance of meeting our colleagues in an informal and natural environment to build connections and foster trust so that we feel like home. Leisure events, Christmas dinner and summer party are waiting for you!

To be a best fit for this opportunity you will need:
Good English level (B2+), German is a plus.
+3 years in a BI role, ideally in an international company.
Strong knowledge in Data Modelling
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory and Azure DataLake
Very good communication and training skills
Knowledge of Power Automate and Dataverse is a plus

You will be responsible for:
Creating meaningful Reports and Dashboards based on PowerBI
Supporting & Consulting our Process Owners and Financial Controlling regarding Reports and Dashboards
Managing processes and integrating information from different APIs in Azure Datalake using Azure Data Factory.
Training of internal Subject matter experts

Are you still curious? Discover what it is to become part of ERNI:
https://www.youtube.com/@erniacademy1024/videos

WOULD YOU LIKE TO BECOME AN ERNIan? APPLY NOW!

job description:
About the job
Who we are

The Workshop is a tech company that develops intuitive software for the online gaming industry. Our motto is to move “Fearlessly Forward” together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything we do – from our games, new products and technologies, to how we collaborate and share inspiration with one another.

Your mission

As a BI Engineering Analyst, you will be responsible for providing insight and analysis into the performance of our delivery procedures and teams. You will combine your domain knowledge and experience of quantitative and statistical methods to ensure that our overall strategies become ‘data driven’ and that Sr. Managers & Directors are able to consume the reports and insights needed to align to key performance indicators.

You will be part of a team responsible for driving insight into the effectiveness, quality and finance of software engineering projects, generating the insight to drive decision-making and informing development strategies. You will be required to support across many engineering teams covering several areas of analysis, such as delivery performance, team productivity, technology alignment, among other. You will be able to understand software development concepts and terminology and interpret the data to report to leadership.

What you'll do

Structure, analyse and report on performance from data extraction (SQL), to integration of new data sources and statistical analysis (Python) to visualization (Tableau or other visualization tool).
As part of the Business Intelligence team, develop and implement best practice methodologies for the quantitative analysis & visualization of data.
Work with Engineering to define and measure the key behaviours within services, identify key data points and how they relate to broader engineering strategies.
Define and measure business success, OKR accomplishment, quality metrics, standards and reporting.
Lead meeting with users and technical architects to gather requirements.
Design conceptual data model in order to depict new solutions along with logical data model.
Carry out analysis of the existing data sources and business processes to determine the construction and testing time of a data product to be deployed.
Perform hands-on analysis in support of business requests, including development of conclusions and recommendations.
Understand the business issues and data challenges of client's organization and industry.
Identify client organization's strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement.
Assist in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.

What you'll bring

Degree educated or equivalent experience, preferably in STEM areas (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or Operations Research).
Personable character and a good communicator – ability to communicate complex, technical concepts to non-technical staff.
+ 3 year of experience in Business Intelligence, reporting & visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI).
Proven insight domain knowledge (e.g.: customer 360 view, financial analysis, process effectiveness).
+2 years of experience working on SQL relational database knowledge and Excel skills.
Data manipulation, modelling and analysis skills.
This position requires limited International travel.

Nice to have:

Experience transforming data using Python.
Experience working with software engineering teams.
Experience working with PostgreSQL and API data integration projects.

What's in it for you

Inspiring and fulfilling work at an innovative and values-driven company creating cutting-edge tech.
Attractive salary and customisable benefits package.
Flexible working hours and ways of working.
Contemporary and accessible office environments with a range of workplace perks.
Six weeks’ paid leave for every four years of service.
Relocation package for you and your family including soft-landing package services to help you settle in (applicable in Spain, if you are moving from a different city/country).
Being part of a team with a forward-looking, international mindset and agile working practices.
A friendly, inclusive and multicultural environment (we are made up of over 35 nationalities, speaking almost 30 languages).
Wellbeing programmes, learning and personal growth opportunities.
A range of employee events throughout the year, including team building activities, Learning Labs, Hackathons and Designathons.
Opportunities to shape the tech community within and outside of the company, through mentoring and knowledge-sharing.

job description:
About the job
About Tripledot
We are an independent mobile games studio, founded by a team of industry veterans from some of the biggest names in mobile games such as King, Peak Games, Facebook, and Product Madness.

Our mission is to bring the knowledge and experience of a chart-topping mobile games company into a close-knit, collaborative environment
Our guiding principle as a team is that when people love what they do, what they do will be loved by others.

The studio is filled with people who love taking things apart and figuring out how they work. We enjoy problem-solving and most importantly, we LOVE making games. We are passionate about our craft and work closely across all disciplines to ensure that passion makes its way into every aspect of our games.

About Tripledot Fortune
Tripledot Fortune is a newly formed and growing division of Tripledot Studios, set up
to design, build and launch mobile Player vs Player games of skill. We currently have 2 games launched in the US, soon to be in the UK as well. With a
3rd game on the way!

About the Role
We are looking for a smart and hungry Product Analyst to join our team. You will
plan and conduct analyses, define metrics, build visualisations, deliver actionable
insights, influence product roadmaps, and make recommendations that answer a
game's most complex, challenging and impactful questions.

You will be using real-time data, industry trends, your wits and experience to make
product decisions, refine ideas through iteration, work closely with the team to
execute them and use data to validate your hypotheses. Your main focus will be
understanding and influencing users’ behaviour.
True to the company’s philosophy, this role will be a combination of art, science, and
business.

Key Responsibilities
Analyse large, complex data sets representing the behaviour of millions of mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions.
Conduct user behaviour deep dives, identifying patterns in critical usage aspects such as playing, purchasing and churning.
Identify areas for improvement; make hypotheses; plan, execute and analyse
A/B tests to improve business metrics.
Use pre/post analyses to understand how product and ecosystem changes are affecting users and the business.
Work closely with Product Managers and other stakeholders to define
meaningful metrics and KPIs.
Define and build user segments that deliver business value.
Partner with and support Live Operations analysts in defining pricing policy
and game economy.
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from game data to shape features and future product roadmaps

Core requirements
Experience at a mobile gaming or B2C mobile app company, in an analysis, scientific, research or consulting role; or demonstrable experience in analysing large data sets as part of an academic research work.
Working knowledge of SQL, comfortable working with large data sets.
B.Sc. in a quantitative or scientific field (Maths, Stats, CS, Engineering, Physics or similar).
Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigour, high attention to detail, and a good business intuition.
Methodical and logical approach to solving business problems.
Experience defining metrics and building visualisations.
A love or strong desire to work with mobile apps and games.

Bonus Requirements
Experience with mobile games
Experience working with Python/R.
Working knowledge of basic ML algos (K-means, DT, linear and logistic regression).
Experience using a data visualisation platform such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI or similar.

Benefits
A flexible and hybrid working model (2 days in the office, 3 WFH)
1 Month Fully Remote working allowance
Yearly Continuous Professional Development (CPD) allowance for learning and development materials, courses, and seminars in addition to fortnightly allotted learning time
Private Health insurance
Dental Cover
Life Cover
Critical Illness cover
Subsidised gym membership
Cycle to work scheme
25 days holiday (with bank holidays on top) + Extra 3 days flexible holiday to cover the end of year festivities.

job description:
About the job
Descripción de la Firma

Deloitte es la firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial. Nuestra misión es mantener el estándar de alta calidad alcanzado gracias a la labor diaria de los más de 10.000 profesionales que trabajan con nosotros en nuestras oficinas repartidas por toda España.

Esta diversidad geográfica permite ofrecer un servicio ágil y eficaz a sus clientes. Deloitte ha sido valorada por universitarios, empleados y la población en general, como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España, gracias a sus políticas de carrera profesional, formación y entorno de trabajo.

Siempre enfocados a las necesidades específicas de cada tipo de negocio, desarrollamos soluciones personalizadas en las áreas de Auditoría, Consultoría, Gestión del Riesgo, Asesoramiento Legal y Fiscal y Asesoramiento en Transacciones.

El verdadero éxito de Deloitte depende de la capacidad de su equipo humano, ¿te animas a unirte a nosotros?

Descripción de la Línea de negocio de Deloitte Digital

Deloitte Digital es una parte creativa e innovadora de Deloitte.

Nuestro trabajo se basa en el conocimiento profundo de los clientes, el mercado potencial y el entorno competitivo para generar una experiencia de cliente diferencial. Nuestras soluciones se centran en las áreas de modelos de negocio de digital, gestión de campañas, analítica web, redes sociales, gestión de contenidos y optimización en medios digitales.

¿Qué nos hace diferentes?

Nuestra diferencia proviene de nuestra diversidad. Tenemos la visión de negocio de un asesor, la capacidad de diseño de una agencia creativa y el conocimiento de la ingeniería de una empresa de tecnología. Ofrecemos propuestas integradas a nuestros clientes en el futuro de la tecnología digital, soluciones que llevan en esencia un intenso compromiso con la calidad.

¿Quieres trabajar con nosotros?

Ofrecemos proyectos de alto nivel, atractivos, dinámicos y con visión de futuro.

Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados

Se precisa incorporar a una persona creativa, que trabaje en equipo, con nivel alto de inglés y apasionada por la consultoría de transformación digital. Así mismo, deberá entender como estos aspectos son relevantes para el negocio de las compañías con las que colaboramos.

Tareas:

Trabajar en proyectos innovadores y diferenciales dentro de la Inteligencia Artificial, el Machine Learning y las arquitecturas Fast Data.

Requisitos:

Titulación superior orientada a Ingeniería. Valorable máster.
Experiencia de 0 a 3 años de experiencia
Valorable conocimiento lenguajes Python, Spark, R, y SAS sobre entornos Big Data y Cloud
Valorable conocimiento arquitectura Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google)
Nivel alto de inglés (hablado y escrito)
Capacidad de adaptación y comunicación
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo
Conocimientos: Ofimática (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)
Iniciativa y dinamismo
Vocación de servicio y enfoque de carrera profesional

Ofrecemos:

Incorporación en Firma líder de servicios profesionales integrados
Desarrollo personal y profesional en un entorno exigente y multidisciplinar
Formación sólida continuada en habilidades y conocimientos técnicos
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Trabajo con equipos internacionales
Integración en un equipo de trabajo cuyos valores comprenden la integridad, diversidad, compromiso, excelencia y generosidad
Contamos con un plan de beneficios sociales muy interesantes. Con nuestro Programa Dwellness, queremos que te relajes y desconectes con nuestras sesiones de mindfulness y fisioterapia, además contamos con servicio médico, enfermería, seguro médico privado y descuentos en gimnasios afiliados, viajes y restaurantes, entre otras muchas cosas…
Y además, te incorporarías en una de las empresas mejor valoradas en Forbes 2019, Actualidad Económica y Universum

¡No lo dudes, ven a Deloitte Digital!

job description:
About the job
Hotelbeds is the world’s leading technology partner, connecting and empowering the world of travel. We’re game-changers, disruptors, the people who bring together local and global brands in accommodation, transport, activities and payments through our network of 300,000 hotels worldwide, 60,000 hard to reach high value clients such as tour operators, travel agents and loyalty schemes across 140 source markets. We are tech-driven, with a customer-first philosophy, and commercial teams whose knowledge and relationships on the ground are second to none. And of course we have an amazing team! Our people, Team Hotelbeds, are the beating heart of the company who we encourage to ‘move fast, dream big and make the difference’ every day. In fact, we believe that it is tech + data + people that truly sets us apart in the market, alongside our ‘global approach, local touch’ mentality. We’re headquartered in Palma, Mallorca and employ around 3,500 people worldwide.

Job Summary

Would you like to work with the most advanced technologies in cloud data warehousing?
Join our expanding Data Delivery team, taking on new challenges to support strategic projects. We aim to put data insights at the heart of every commercial action in our e-commerce business. To do this we need people who are experienced in data modelling, data pipelines, testing and documentation. We want our team to drive our commercial success through the solutions we build.
The company blends a great working environment with lots of challenges. Our HQ is in Palma de Mallorca although the team is based in multiple locations and we practice a hybrid work model. Your internal collaborators will be global with users all over.
We want you to be productive, so we have a modern analytics stack that includes Snowflake for data warehousing, DBT and Airflow for data pipelines, Python for ML modelling and Tableau for data visualizations.
As a Data Warehouse Modeler, you will be expected to contribute to all parts of our data framework. This means that you might be working in SQL to merge datasets, building data pipelines in DBT to land data from external sources or working with the business to create models to support new initiatives.
We don’t expect you to be an expert in all of these things initially, but we want you to be enthusiastic and willing to learn them all.
You should also be comfortable working with stakeholders from around the business to understand their problems and translate them into data products that are robust and scalable. Within our team we utilize agile working methods and you can expect to be given responsibility from the first moment.
So, are you up for the challenge?

Job Responsibilities

Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles.
Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Helping develop reports and analysis.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

Required Skills

Extensive experience with SQL, data modeling architectures, data warehouses, and ELT
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
Proactive and eager to learn new technologies and their usage
Interest in both business knowledge and technical capabilities.
Analytical capabilities

job description:
About the job
Si te apasiona la moda sport y el deporte, en ISRG tenemos mucho que ofrecerte: te damos la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en el grupo líder del retail deportivo multimarca en España, Portugal y Países Bajos, en un proyecto en constante crecimiento y un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades.

Gracias a Sprinter, JD Sports, Sport Zone, Size?, Perrysport, Aktiesport, Bodytone y Deporvillage, contamos con más de 500 tiendas y 10.000 personas que forman parte de esta familia en constante expansión internacional.

Nuestros procesos de selección tienen como objetivo identificar el mejor talento y motivación, con un modelo de gestión por competencias, donde valoramos muy positivamente las experiencias de voluntariado, sociales y del ámbito doméstico.

¿Te unes al equipo?

Como Property Analyst, llevarás a cabo creación distintos informes de KPI, cambios en el área de afluencia (competencia, perfil cliente, operadores de moda..), presentaciones de posibles ubicaciones o mercados (nacionales o internacionales). Como objetivo es interpretación de datos y presentar los resultados para la correcta toma de decisiones a nivel estratégico.


Funciones:

Elaborar informes de KPI de manera semanal o puntual requerida por el grupo (UK), garantizando la calidad de la misma y cumplimiento de deadlines.
Análisis de ubicaciones exactas y estimación de Target en Venta.
Análisis de mercados nuevos y existentes.
Presentación de datos reales a través de estadísticas e informes que faciliten el análisis y toma de decisiones.
Procesamiento de datos de distintos fuentes de información disponibles públicamente o privadas.
Determinación de áreas de afluencias.
Presentación de proyectos en inglés.
Determinación de Pitch de posibles o existentes ubicaciones.
Dar soporte a su responsable en lo que requiera para dotar de rigor los análisis estratégicos de datos al departamento de Expansión.


Requisitos:

Licenciatura en Estadística, Matemáticas, Economía o similar.
Nivel avanzado en paquete Office.
Conocimiento y uso de BBDD.
Inglés B2.
Experiencia previa de al menos 2 años en un puesto similar
Experiencia previa en el tratamiento de datos y elaboración de informes para la toma de decisiones.
Disponibilidad para viajar.

Valorable:

Uso de programas/plataformas de análisis de datos (Tableau, Qlikview, Microstrategy, SAS).
Conocimiento de software o plataformas de GIS Análisis y datos geográficos.
Conocimientos sector retail.


Desde el grupo ISRG ofrecemos un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades. Todas las personas serán consideradas sin importar su identidad de género, orientación sexual, etnia, religión, edad o grado de discapacidad.

Nuestros procesos de selección están basados en el modelo de evaluación por competencias profesionales y valoramos la pasión, ganas de aprender y de crecer en un entorno internacional.

¿Qué más ofrecemos?

Porcentaje sobre objetivos.
Flexibilidad horaria.
Teletrabajo.
Bonificación fiscal/flexible (seguro médico, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería).
Descuento empleado/a.
Plan de desarrollo personalizado y carrera en un entorno internacional.
Formación continua tanto en hard skills y soft skills.
Instalaciones deportivas dentro de la empresa.
Restaurante interno con comida healthy y económica.

job description:
About the job
Esta es una excelente oportunidad para iniciar o avanzar en tu carrera profesional en el área de BI y formar parte de una multinacional presente en los 5 continentes.

Somos un equipo sólido y altamente cualificado en Microsoft, SAP, Salesforce, Amazon entre otros.

Únete al equipo VISEO, te estamos esperando!

¿Qué harás?

En VISEO podrás desempeñar tareas a lo largo de todo el ciclo de vida del desarrollo, desde la toma de requisitos hasta la implementación y análisis/diseño de informes.

Formarás parte de un equipo de expertos en BI, y participaras en proyectos pioneros tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.
Podrás diseñar tu plan de carrera dentro del equipo y sus diferentes roles: Data Analyst, Data engineer, Data Architect, Project Manager etc.

¿Qué tecnología utilizarás en el departamento?

Utilizarás Power BI, TABLEAU, QLIK, SAP Analytics cloud , SQL Server, BIGDATA, , AZURE, AWS, ETC.

¿Qué perfil estamos buscando?

Buscamos perfiles que quieran iniciar su carrera profesional en BI o quieran seguir desarrollándose en esta área.

Para las personas que no tengan experiencia, valoraremos tener carrera técnica o analítica.
Valoramos positivamente formación en Business Intelligence (BBDD, procesos ETL, Reporting…).
En caso de tener experiencia previa valoraremos tener conocimientos en Transact SQL, SSIS, PowerBI, Tableau, PowerCEnter, MDX o DAX en Plataforma Azure o Amazon.

¿Qué funciones realizarás?

Desarrollo de aplicaciones usando la plataformas como Azure o AWS.

Toma de requerimientos, análisis y modelado de aplicaciones.

Proyectos bigdata, analítica predictiva, ETL’s, mantenimientos, etc.

Desarrollar proyectos de implementación de procesos de carga sobre estas plataformas para asegurar la entrega de este, en términos de calidad, tiempo y coste.

Formar y apoyar al cliente durante las primeras fases de la utilización de la herramienta.

Investigar problemas y diagnosticar su raíz. Realización de pruebas integradas del sistema.

Implementar soluciones de BI a medida de nuestros clientes.

Elaboración documentación del proyecto.

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Qué podemos ofrecerte, desde VISEO 😉

En el caso de que tu perfil sea Junior, comenzarás con una formación inicial de varias semanas.
Habrá revisiones salariales periódicamente.
Sistema de mentorizado desde tu inicio. Tendrás a una persona guía (mentor) durante todo el periodo de desarrollo para guiarte en la consecución de tus objetivos.
Formación continua: Tendrás acceso a certificaciones, cursos o charlas de Microsoft.

💫En VISEO, también contamos con Beneficios Sociales para todas las personas que forman parte de este equipo, por lo tanto también tendrás:

Flexibilidad horaria y posibilidad de teletrabajo.
Ayuda económica para el teletrabajo.
Salario competitivo.
Retribución flexible, que podrá destinarse a ticket restaurant, ticket de transporte o cheque guardería.
Vacaciones: 26 días al año
Seguro médico gratuito.
Formación para la consecución de otro idioma (ingles, alemán, francés) dentro de nuestra plataforma de Learning.
Ayuda económica para estudiar idiomas.

¿Cómo y cuándo daremos respuesta a tu solicitud?

💨 CUÁNDO: Lo más rápido posible, queremos dedicaros nuestro tiempo a todas las personas que os habéis presentado.

💥CÓMO: Lo haremos mediante email o mediante llamada telefónica para que tengáis toda la información referente al proceso.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI’s mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies’ ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies’ sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account
skills: Análisis de datos, Microsoft Excel, Capacidad de análisis, Python, Inglés, Comunicación, and SQL

job description:
About the job
SumUp is a digital ecosystem dedicated to local entrepreneurs. Our range of solutions answers all our merchants' challenges; from reservations, through click and collect, deliveries and digital payment, to the management of their business thanks to intuitive and comprehensive financial analytics.

In SumUp POS, we are creating the world’s most complete Point of Sale, for all merchants in all businesses. We take care of the details so that merchants can focus on what they do best. We help merchants better connect to their business, to their customers and to each other.

SumUp POS offers more than a cash register, it offers an innovative ecosystem where our POS Tribe of over 400 people in Paris, Milan, Barcelona, Germany and the UK are working hard to go as far as possible and become the European leader in our market.

What you’ll do:

Build clear product KPIs and data models to help measure the effectiveness of our product strategies in achieving overall business goals
Empower our product lifecycle from ideation to launch with data-driven insights, quantitative analyses, actionable recommendations and other ad hoc support
Generate reports, dashboards, presentations etc. to nurture a data-driven community
Build and maintain a strong communication network with Product, Engineering, Data Platform & Commercial stakeholders

Previous experience:

5+ years of experience in a similar role working with Product & Engineering
Experience with Segment and Google Analytics (or similar product analytics tool)
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests)
Experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar
Great visualisation skills, ideally with Tableau
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities and roadmapStrong SQL and data modelisation skills, with Dbt a big plus

Why you should join SumUp:

Have full autonomy (for real!) to propose, lead and implement changes that will up our game.
You will have the freedom to drive your career, own projects and make an impact across the company.
An amazing team and work environment that works with passion and purpose to achieve incredible results.
We get together regularly for breakfasts, team events, office parties and sports.

Additional Information 💫
Start date: as soon as possible
Full-time
Work office location(s) - Hybrid, based from Paris, Barcelona, London, Milan
Remote working: Yes - need to be based in country Location

Meet us! 💬
Recruiter Interview - 30 Minutes
VP Product Exec Interview - 45 Minutes
Analytics Lead - 45 Minutes
Test - with restitution to the product analyst pool
Bar Raiser Interview - 45 Minutes

About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first’ attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

job description:
About the job
Description

We’re expanding our team within Amazon European Central Flow!

*What we do*

Support FC Leadership by providing relevant expertise to help them manage their area of the fulfillment business. ECFT Process Control Specialists partner with senior leaders in our fulfillment centers to deliver world class operational standards that create great outcomes for customers.

Simplify, Standardize, and Improve Processes by using our expertise and strategic position within Amazon fulfillment to innovate on behalf of the customer every day. Through providing standard ways of working that span the entire European flow network ECFT is able to reduce defects in the process and improve the speed at which customers receive their order.

Drive business goals such as overall volume plan, peerless customer experience, and reducing the time between a customer clicking “Buy” and receiving their order.

Making lives easier for our operations partners by reducing necessary process steps in the pursuit of autonomous flow management within the fulfillment network.

*Why we do it*

At Amazon we believe every day is Day 1, the European Central Flow team realizes that vision on a daily basis by delivering on the goals above and providing a central location for operational excellence within the Amazon customer fulfillment network. By doing so we continuously improve the buying experience from our customers and further our ambitious mission of being Earth’s most customer-centric company.

*Your role*

As a Logistics Analyst (internally called Process Control Specialist) you will be responsible for the day-to-day management of flow standards in a partner Fulfillment Center (FC). You will work together with Operations leaders to plan, then execute a shift while escalating risks or standard work deviations to senior managers. The Logistics Analyst is expected act as a key advisor on all matters relating to customer fulfillment.

**As part of this role you will need to be flexible to work on shift patterns including night, and weekend working**
Become a subject matter expert in flow management tools and processes, and how they interface with FC operations.
Carry out deep dive analysis into improvement opportunities, promoting and leading comprehensive action plans across multiple stakeholders.
Partnering with varied stakeholder groups across multiple business areas and levels of seniority. Communication of complex topics in an accessible way is a critical element of the role.
Track, communicate, and influence key performance indices such as customer risk, compliance with flow planning, and performance to site level KPIs
Take part in coaching initiatives to share your knowledge of the area with operators, or train new team members as part of their on-boarding.

Basic Qualifications
You are fluent in English
You have a strong track record of communication skills across multiple stakeholder groups.
You are a problem solver, comfortable working with data to make critical decisions.
You have excellent judgement, and be able to make decisions under pressure. You will be able to influence others in pressured situations in pursuit of great outcomes.
You are flexible in working patterns
Preferred Qualifications
Fluency in another European language
Able to show experience working in remote / centralized teams
Data science skills including SQL
Please upload a CV in English.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - AMZN Spain Fulfillment, S.L.U.

excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con más de 20 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias.
