job description:
About the job
What we are looking for :

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

What You Will Do

Prepare and distribute timely and insightful financial analysis with actionable insights and provide recommendations for local business including divisional and enabling functions leadership.
Drive monthly P&L reviews with defined KPIs for all divisions within the region and provide analysis against budget and projection.
Actively interpret and review the results with the business, including trends/issues and opportunities to drive actionable responses.
Guide and support the business to take decisions on well supported financial grounds through business case analysis.
Prepare insightful and dynamic reporting (BI Analytics) for wide range of stakeholders to drive greater insight and visibility into divisional and Enabling Functions financial performance (utilization of Power BI as the main reporting and presentation tool). The regional reports include but are not limited to: sales and gross margin performance, market share and price/volume analysis by customer, expense analysis focusing on marketing and compensation drivers to provide insights for CTG initiatives, among others.
Provide financial analysis and recommendations to ensure business objectives are achieved as they relate to tender negotiations, pricing, or other commercial negotiations.
Actively support structured arrangements and cross divisional deals.
Provide analytical support to Commercial Business to gain a better understanding of market trends, customer trends, and sales channel performance
Perform necessary analysis that aids in the decision-making process and help improve business performance’
Review P&L and Balance Sheet information and identify errors or exceptions and provide information and insight to ensure correct journals and results. Determination of journal entry amounts for certain revenue and opex categories.
Flash commentary submission to Europe in collaboration with the Business Controller

Budgeting Cycle and Projections:

Plan, collect and consolidate input data for Budget and Projections with well documented assumptions for the P&L and Balance Sheet, including but not limited to: compensation marketing, discretionary, professional services, among others.
Responsible for communicating and reporting of Budget and Projections to the business and enabling functions, when needed.
Support in ensuring forecasting accuracy for the region.
Play an active role in improving Budget and Projection processes.

Other tasks/projects:

Actively participate in projects to further improve finance processes
Identify opportunities for cross divisional collaboration and Flex Finance solutions in the region and work actively with the business to provide the necessary analytical support to aid the deals.
Provide support and insights to the SPI working team and Shrinkage project
Support Assets and Compliance with Capital Placement assessment.
Other: ad hoc projects as assigned by Finance Business Leader and Divisional Finance Director.
Active involvement in business cases to aid decision making and help improve business performance, such as ROI analysis on deals, tender’s profitability analysis, flex finance options assessment, GPOs agreements or rebates negotiations.
Assist to secure the internal controls for local finance is aligned with corporate policies.
Strong cooperation with local AR team for accruals, rebates, and development of processes.
Support during internal and external audits.

Who You Are

You have a Master Degree in Business and Administration, Finance or other related areas
You have 5+ years of relevant working experience as an Analyst or Accountant preferably within a multinational sales organization
You are fluent in Spanish and English
You have a proven expertise in data analytics, ERP knowledge
You have practical experience of advanced use of excel, financial modelling and data analytics preferrable
Experienced in analyzing data, reporting and month end closing. Preferably within a large complex business.
Process improvement experience (i.e. Lean/Six sigma experience) is an advantage
Demonstrable ability to drive projects that will significantly impact the business
Experience in Medical Device is a plus

Technical skills we are interested in :

Professional certification in controlling (RC/CIMA/CFA) or studying is a plus

Familiar with US GAAP and Sarbanes Oxley

Familiar with a bigger ERP system (such as Oracle or SAP)

Knowledge in Hyperion, Danube, PowerBI is a plus

Advanced Excel skills

What do we offer in return?

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. Stryker is a career destination for engaged, passionate and talented people who are driven to seek the innovation, growth and opportunity that only we offer.

Flat hierarchies and responsibility: through flat hierarchies, we strengthen the initiative and willingness of our employees to take over responsible tasks.
Team spirit & engagement: we create engaged and inclusive teams that encourage colleagues to share their diverse perspectives and opinions.
Recognition of your performance: at our company, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.
Competitive salary: with us, you will receive a competitive remuneration package, benefits as well as a pension plan.

job description:
About the job
We are offering a Jr Account & Ad Ops position to help us build the global contextual advertising leader.

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

KEY FIGURES
2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers
2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth
2021 · Fundraising round of 40M€ & +12 countries & +300 Seedtaggers
2022 · +125M€ in revenue and fundraising round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S market
2023 · + 450 Seedtaggers

YOUR CHALLENGE
You will support of our sales team with local and international customers
You will handle the Campaign management, reporting and controlling
You will be responsible for creative concepts and the development of new ideas as well as their innovative implementation
You will supervise direct and programmatic customer campaigns
You will manage the exchange of insights and campaign-relevant information with our clients and agencies
You will work in close cooperation with our publisher team
You will execute project tasks in an independent manner

YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF
You have completed an (industry-relevant) education or degree
You are inventive and have strong communication skills, with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced media environment
You have an excellent team spirit
You have a high affinity to digital trends and online marketing
You are data-oriented and familiar with Excel (MS Office skills) / Spreadsheets (Google Workspace)
You are curious to learn, strong accuracy and attention to detail whilst maintaining strong time management and prioritization skills
You enjoy diversified activities in a dynamic work environment
You are willing to grow together with us
Any experience in the digital advertising industry; agency or client side is a bonus

SEEDTAGGER´S EXPERIENCE
Sofía Machado (Head of AdOps): " One of the things I like the most about my job is that no day is the same: you can do a whole different work from one day to the next, depending on the tasks that need to be done. You also have the chance to interact with many people, from a variety of departments and get to know different areas of the company. At AdOps, you can expect that: as we're in the core of the company, you get to meet a lot of people and collaborate with them to get your job done. In here you'll experience what team-work is for real and you'll see that even if we're close to 300 employees now, it still feels like family. Everyone supports each other and share innovative ideas which help us growing exponentially"

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG
Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s alwaysa been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

SEEDTAG PERKS
🇬🇧🇫🇷🇪🇸 Optional company-paid English, French and/or Spanish courses
🏋 Gympass
☕ A great workplace location with food, snacks, great coffee and much more
🍻 We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues!
📚 Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Startup valenciana tecnológica especializada en la aplicación de la Neurociencia y las Nuevas Tecnologías en el ámbito empresarial.

job description:
About the job
La Sirena, líder en el sector de la distribución de productos congelados y en plena expansión, actualmente cuenta con más de 270 establecimientos comerciales.
Nuestra misión es regalar a nuestros clientes, tiempo, salud y sabor a la vida!!! además, de proporcionarles la gama más amplia de productos congelados y ofrecer una calidad y diferenciación digna de nuestra experiencia y liderazgo.

Nuestro equipo humano está formado por más de 1000 colaboradores y su papel es clave para el crecimiento de nuestra compañía. Creemos en su talento, en su crecimiento personal y profesional y , en la formación como herramienta estratégica para el desarrollo de sus carreras profesionales.

¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?
Participarás en la toma y análisis de nuevos requerimientos para el desarrollo de soluciones de BI para recoger necesidades del negocio, proponer soluciones y mejoras.

Darás soporte y formación a los usuarios para que entiendan el modelo de datos disponible y tengan autonomía a la hora de realizar informes.

Diseñarás, implementarás y harás mantenimiento de modelos de Datos usando InfoObjetos, Data source, DTP, Transformaciones, ADSO, Composites, Queries, Vistas HANA….

Diseñarás, realizarás la implementación, mantenimiento y monitorización de los procesos de carga de datos de las distintas fuentes de información al DataWarehouse para garantizar la disponibilidad de los datos a los usuarios consumidores de información.

Realizarás el diseño y la elaboración de informes corporativos y cuadros de mando para usuarios de las herramientas de reporting de la compañía, para cubrir las necesidades de análisis de información de los distintos departamentos. Harás el mantenimiento y monitorización del sistema de reporting para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento.

¿Cuáles son los requisitos?
Formación relacionada con ingeniería informática, telecomunicaciones, datos o similar.
Más 3 años de experiencia en proyectos en SAP BW idealmente SAP BW/4HANA o SAP DWC.
Experiencia en diseño y desarrollo de flujos de datos de extremo a extremo para BW/4HANA/DWC.
Experiencia en herramientas de ETL, idealmente SQL Server Integration Services y SAP data Services.
Experiencia con herramientas de informes: SAP BObj 4.3, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) y Analysis for Office (AFO).
Experiencia en SQL y bases de datos SAP HANA.
Capacidad de adaptación y resolución de tareas de manera autónoma.
Alto grado de adaptación a trabajo en grupo, habilidades de comunicación con miembros de otros equipos.
¿Qué valoraremos técnicamente?
Herramientas para la creación de ETL’s: SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) / SAP Data Services
Herramientas BI: SAP BW/4HANA / Se valorará conocimiento de SAP Data warehouse Cloud, SAP BW Bridge, SAP Analytics Cloud Planning
Herramientas Reporting: SAP BObj, SAP Analitycs Cloud, Analysis For Office (AFO), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
Conocimientos Bases de datos: SQL Server / SAP HANA
Programación en: HANA Scripts, Python, ABAP.
Valorable conocimiento en SAP FI-CO

¿Qué ofrecemos?
Contrato Indefinido.
Dos días de teletrabajo a la semana
Horario flexible y viernes intensivo.
Descuentos en todas las compras sirena + vale regalo.
Posibilidad de seguro médico.
Salario a concretar según experiencia.

job description:
About the job
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on professional to support our Live Operations Analytics department in our headquarters in Barcelona. You will act and operate as a startup within a startup, providing both strategic thinking and analytical skills to help building excellence in Operations with focus into one specific region

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand the operations model in Glovo to provide advice to the different teams
Contribute to the business discussion by suggesting different and novel analysis approaches
Translate business queries into quantified & insightful reporting and KPIs to assess performance and determine the effectiveness of the implemented initiatives
Ensure scalability of the reporting
Own creation and structure of Live Operations KPIs, ensure they are properly implemented in the DDBB
Define and design dashboards to give visibility to the top-management of the Live Operations performance
Follow a data-driven decision-making process
Report to the Operations Analytics Manager
You Have
Bachelor in Engineering, Maths/Physics
1-2 years of experience working on analytics in a similar/relevant industry
Demonstrated proficiency in working with clean & optimized SQL, querying mid to large volumes of data
Consulting experience is a plus
Python is a plus
Good understanding of how to extract insights from Data Warehouses
Ability to summarize and represent data (e.g descriptive statistics and graphs)
Ability to create robust, insightful, and story-telling visualizations using modern BI & Analytics tools and ability to identify data Issues
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in a high growth and high performance start-up with a fast pace
Itchy feet and continuous thrive on learning through different projects
Professional English
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!

Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
Top-notch private health insurance
Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
Discounted gym memberships
Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
Care: Uplift people and the planet
Glownership: Act as proud owners
High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

job description:
About the job
Who we are
Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.
Our services are based on a Digital Factory model. Through this model we help companies to accelerate its digital transformation projects with an end-to-end approach.

We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.

As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don’t hesitate to apply!

What you will do:
You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team

Required skills:
At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Knowledge of front-end web and mobile technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SDKs)
Experience in digital data collection (tracking), Firesbase and/or tag management systems
Experience in standard digital analytical tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Experience with AB testing, personalization, customer data platforms, and/or data activation is a plus
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL…), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Knowledge of script languages such as Python, R, Scala e.g., with Apache Spark is a plus
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language


Apply to our offer…
💟 If you are passionate about technologies
💟 If you define yourself as a team worker
💟 If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team
💟 If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing
💟 If you want to work in an international environment

Our offering:
✨ Permanent contract
✨ Competitive salary
✨ 22 days of vacation
✨ 5 additional holidays for Christmas
✨ 4 additional holidays for Easter
✨ Flexible working time
✨ Continuous working days in summer

Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

job description:
About the job
¿Eres un apasionado/a de la analítica y el marketing digital?

Entonces, ¡Ésta es tu carrera!

En Deporvillage, uno de los mayores e-commerce de España y líder en su sector, buscamos a alguien que le apasionen los retos, que tenga iniciativa y muchas ganas de liderar todo el desarrollo de la marca propia de Deporvillage.

Somos jóvenes, ambiciosos, emprendedores, dinámicos y muy trabajadores; y tenemos la suerte de contar con un equipo profesional y experto digno de la mejor de las competiciones.

¿A quién necesitamos en nuestro equipo?

Esto es una carrera de fondo y para seguir alcanzando nuevas metas y nuevos triunfos, necesitamos incorporar un/a Business Analyst, donde tu principal responsabilidad será el análisis de las métricas del área de negocio donde se incluye: marketing online, CRM, Pricing y Comunicación, para poder aportar propuestas de mejora y ayudar a tomar decisiones relevantes para el negocio basadas en datos.

Pensamos en una persona con experiencia previa en e-commerce, analítica y con clara visión de negocio y de cliente, capaz de aportar propuestas de mejora y detectar posibles desviaciones para actuar sobre ella.

Tus principales funciones serán:
Analizar el comportamiento del usuario, así como el tráfico, conversión y captación de nuevos usuarios
Desarrollar un análisis en profundidad sobre el comportamiento del cliente, para aumentar la frecuencia y retención de clientes.
Proporcionar soporte analítico, con enfoque en la orientación empresarial y en los proyectos asignados.
Proveer de análisis económicos y estratégicos, elaboración de informes y recomendaciones para la toma de decisiones.
Gestionar y supervisar el análisis de negocio para apoyar la toma de decisiones en la estrategia y en el negocio de las áreas de responsabilidad. Identificar y evaluar nuevas oportunidades de negocio e iniciativas para aumentar la creación de valor.
Seguimiento de los costes: cálculo de los costes para los distintos servicios, monitorizar los costes y desviaciones, identificar oportunidades de ahorro de costes y beneficios.


¿Qué te pedimos?
Que poseas una experiencia mínima de 3 años en puesto similar
Que tengas un enfoque “user centricity”
Que tengas experiencia gestionando proyectos en e-commerce
Que seas una persona con gran capacidad de analítica con alto volumen de datos
Que tengas visión de negocio y capacidad para aportar propuestas de valor
Que tengas conocimientos de Google Analytics UA y GA4 o plataforma similar
Que poseas experiencia en herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI
Será valorable conocimientos en SQL

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
·Un ambiente de trabajo joven y dinámico
Participar en un proyecto referente en el área de e-commerce y en pleno crecimiento
Horario flexible
Posibilidad de 1dia/semana trabajo en remoto
Remuneración acorde valía del candidato

Nuestras oficinas se sitúan en Manresa

job description:
About the job
As Business Analyst in the Pricing Analytics COE you will shape HP’s future of how we market and price our products. We are a very dynamic, highly skilled and diverse global team consisting of data scientists, economists, computer scientists, engineers, project managers, and product owners. Working with us you will combine your analytical & and coding skills, economic/business thinking, stakeholder engagement and project management skills to help push the innovation frontier in the way HP sets prices for its products.

About You
You are interested in customer and market behaviour and methods to measure and anticipate it.
You are a data driven person, with a passion to identify patterns in the data, identify the root cause, and propose solutions.
You are passionate about coding, simplifying the complex, automation and making processes more efficient.
You are keen to be in contact with users/ customers, data scientists.
To you problems are like puzzles, you are never satisfied until its solved
Responsibilities
Leverage data analytics technique and visualization tools like Excel, PowerBI and Tableau to reconcile, analyze and transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Present the results and recommendations to the project team and contribute to the action plan for improvements.
Data guru of the team: good knowledge of where and how to get the right data metrics for the right analysis
Develop and implement frameworks and processes to make your analyses and algorithms easily replicable, scalable and automated.
Analyze the adoption of the pricing solution and work on improvement plans with the business/users.
Requirements
At least 3 years’ working experience in business analysis/ project management field, with at least 1 year of experience in stakeholder management.
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint. PowerBI or Tableau is required.
Excellent analytical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to think creatively and invent original solutions to business.
Organized, structured and good housekeeping skill when handing data
Strong verbal and written communication skills, including negotiation and presentation.
Demonstrated project management skills.
Bachelor or Master's degree
English proficiency
Interest in pricing, economics, and consumer behavior
Basic understanding of finance and product economics
Experience in deploying ML and data science solutions.
Knowledge of R or Python
Project management certifications preferred: PMI, Agile
What We Offer
Opportunity to work in an international organization with colleagues coming from all over the world.
Diverse, continued internal growth and career opportunities. Including HP’s own learning platform and LinkedIn Learning.
An attractive benefit package.
Women, Pride, Young employees and DisAbility, just a few of our fantastic global business networks
We also dedicate time and resources to contribute with our community through Corporate Volunteering activities.
About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Firma española de consultoría tecnológica con más de 300 profesionales con perfil multidisciplinar, de altísimo rendimiento, titulados superiores y presencia en toda España (8 oficinas). Las claves del éxito de nuestro modelo de Compañía son: profesionalidad y rigor, orientación al cliente, uso de todo tipo de tecnologías, innovación para construir soluciones diferenciales en el mercado, experiencia (grupo con más de 20 años trabajando juntos, caso único en el mercado), sentido práctico y máximo compromiso con nuestros proyectos, clientes y equipos.

job description:
About the job
We are seeking a highly motivated Content & Search Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying cost-effective content options and developing optimal itinerary combinations in collaboration with our Content and Search product teams. Leveraging your expertise in data analysis, you will extract insights to evaluate current solutions and identify new opportunities for improvement. Additionally, you will monitor performance metrics and raise any issues or propose enhancements to optimize our overall performance

What will you do?

Define, lead, and coordinate quick corrective actions to address missed opportunities, and follow up with relevant stakeholders to ensure long-term sustainable solutions are in place.
Analyze, understand, and report on cache, content sources, and itinerary engine key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide actionable business recommendations that optimize performance, costs, and revenues.
Independently build meaningful and visually appealing self-service dashboards that enable stakeholders to quickly access and understand key data insights.
Develop business cases to calculate the return on investment (ROI) of engineering developments and partner contract negotiations.
Set up and automate data-related team processes to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including Product, Engineering, Data platform, Data modeling, and Business Development teams, to ensure alignment and achieve shared objectives.

What do we expect?

Strong data literacy skills and experience working with large datasets to solve complex problems, identify trends, and uncover root causes by understanding business and product dynamics.
Proficiency in data visualization and reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Experience working with spreadsheets such as Excel or Google Sheets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Prior experience in the travel industry and e-commerce is preferred.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python is a plus.
Familiarity with Agile methodology is a plus.

We offer you

The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme.
We give our employees the freedom to choose between the environment of work from home and our modern office located in the centric neighbourhood (Passeig de Gràcia) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com ’s private office space, two common terraces with great views, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, GymForLess membership, and the annual subscription for El Bicing.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.
Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences.
We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.
Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel!

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it’s finished, we’re going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

job description:
About the job
Goal summary:
We are looking to hire a data analyst to join our data team. You will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases

Main tasks and responsibilities
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Removing corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems
Developing and maintaining databases, data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format
Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
Filter Data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time
Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
Preparing reports for the management statingtrends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Working with programmers, engineers, and management the ads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends

Professional Skills
At least 5 years work experience as a senior data analyst
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Oracle, R, MATLAB, and Python
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Experience in handling reporting packages like Business Objects, programming (Javascript, XML, or ETL frameworks), databases
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing
Adept at using data processing platforms like Hadoop and Apache Spark
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions
Problem-solving skills
Accuracy and attention to detail
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Team-working skill
Verbal and Written communication skills
Proven working experience in data analysis

What do we offer?
Be part of a leading brand in full expansion process (SHA México and SHA Emirates), in a multicultural environment, with first class professionals, making a great positive impact on the planet We are Green Globe!
We take care of your health and wellbeing through weCare, a programme designed for our talents, which includes free daily healthy menus prepared by our team of Chefs, free medical consultations, fitness and meditation sessions, discounts at local businesses and many other activities.
We want you to grow and learn every day and that's why we are committed to your career plan and continuous training with our SHA Academy.
Helping people to achieve and maintain optimal health, so that they can enjoy their full physical, mental and spiritual potential. We are driven to give our best and we want to make a global impact!
Possibility of working remotely

position: Data Business Support Analyst - SCF Global Services
job description:
About the job
Country: Spain

What You Will Be Doing

Santander Consumer Finance GS is looking for a Data Business Support Analyst, based in our Boadilla del Monte office.

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY

At Santander (www.santander.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us?

Santander Consumer Finance focuses on business development related to consumer finance products, sales channels and commercial agreements with dealers, vehicle manufacturers or retail distribution establishments, as well as commercial functions associated with direct sales (branches, call centers or digital channels) and indirect sales (through third parties) of consumer finance products.

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture, and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper. We embrace a strong risk culture and all our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management.

What You Will Be Doing

As a Business Support SR Analyst, you will part of the Digital Consumer Bank project, three hubs emerged within Santander Consumer Finance aiming of standardizing tasks, generating synergies, and allowing the sharing of best practices quickly and efficiently.

In addition to the hubs, more related to the structural and organizational aspect of the initiative, when referring to the business model of SCF group, given the intensification of SCF's competitive environment, the need to expand the product portfolio to meet the new demands of consumers, both in the automotive and the unsecured business, arises.

For these reasons, we seek to strengthen the analytical team of SCF collections (HQ) to support local units in all these global initiatives.

We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:
Management of centralized databases to support Collections activity across SCF footprint and products array.
Contribute to and support deployment of the Collections model commensurate to new business lines that SCF may explore.
Conduct necessary testing, including UATs, prior to implementing any improvement(s) to systems or processes.
Data cleansing and coordination of daily data exchange process with third parties including processing of CBU results (Financial & Operational).
Set up Reporting framework incl. ad hoc analysis for supporting BAU collections management and consolidation.
Back-office support and coordination among different CBUs (Collections Business Units) and local counterparts such us IT, Risk, Finance, among others.

Experience
5+ years of experience with Data Management and Data Mining Strong analytical and data skills Experience in retail / consumer banking business.

EDUCATION
Master's degree (M.Sc.) in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar.

Skills & Knowledge
High level of knowledge Excel, SAS, SQL. Any other programming language would be valuable.
Knowledge in Collections and IT related tools and banking applications is a plus.
Good spoken and written English, any other language would be valuable.

Other Information
Availability to travel.

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

job description:
About the job
¿Te apasiona el Análisis de Datos? Buscamos una persona curiosa y creativa, con ganas de trabajar en equipo y de crecer y fomentar el crecimiento.

Incorporándote en el departamento de Inteligencias de Negocio, te integrarás en el equipo que impulsa el uso de los datos en la toma de decisiones de negocio transversal de toda la compañía y en general la obtención del máximo valor de negocio a partir del dato.
Tus principales funciones
Automatización de procesos utilizando las herramientas de BI y Analíticas (MicroStrategy, R).
Implantar metodologías de trabajo, impulsando el uso de herramientas analíticas corporativas y de tratamiento de los datos de la forma más eficiente posible.
Formar y mentorizar a personas de otros departamentos en el uso de estas herramientas.
Impulsar la Cultura Analítica, realizar acciones de divulgación sobre la extracción de valor a partir del dato y nuevas metodologías de análisis.
Trabajarás con otros departamentos para desarrollar soluciones basadas en datos, que respondan a sus necesidades de negocio.
Fomentar las sinergias interdepartamentales en el uso de los datos, impulsar el uso de terminología común (Business Glossary).
Participar en la consolidación de Grupo Caja de Ingenieros como una Entidad Data Driven, impulsando de forma transversal la toma de decisiones de negocio basadas en datos de forma óptima, así como la implantación de la cultura analítica o del dato, ajustada a los criterios éticos y de gobernanza.
Requisitos
Grado en ADE, Estadística, Matemáticas o Ingenierías.
Valorable Máster o Postgrado en Business Intelligence, Data Science o Data Analytics.
Mínimo 1 año de experiencia realizando análisis.
Valorable experiencia en sector financiero o asegurador.
Imprescindible conocimientos de herramientas de análisis R o Python: librerías TidyVerse, Pandas, Sklearn, etc. Visualización de datos: librerías ggplot, seaborn.
Valorable conocimientos de plataformas de BI y análisis: Microstrategy, Business Objects, etc. y de herramientas de CRM: Siebel, etc.
Valorable conocimientos de SQL y Visual Basic.
Catalán / Castellano
Inglés nivel First Certificate
Habilidades y experiencias
Capacidades Analíticas
Actitud Resolutiva
Capacidad de Aprendizaje
Adaptación al Cambio
Proactividad y Orientación a la Mejora
Trabajo en Equipo
Habilidades de Comunicación
Visualización de Datos

Ubicación: Barcelona
Contrato indefinido (contratación directa)
Jornada híbrida: 2 días teletrabajo, 3 presenciales.
Jornada intensiva viernes y agosto
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales
Buen ambiente de trabajo dinámico y colaborativo.

job description:
About the job
¿Quieres formar parte de una compañía especializada 100% en proyectos propios de#Data & #Analytics? Sí es así, ¡Sigue leyendo! 👀

Aunque somos poco conocidos entre el gran público, en SDG trabajamos para la mitad de grupos del IBEX-35 y en multitud de empresas internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento y desde 1994 ayudamos a nuestros clientes a entender y analizar sus datos.


¿Qué nos hace diferentes? 🧐

En nuestros proyectos, los datos y la tecnología son los protagonistas, te formaremos para que puedas trabajar con lo último del mercado (tenemos un área de innovación dónde impulsamos nuevos partnerships con fabricantes tecnológicos y centros de I+D).

Tendrás todas las oportunidades para alcanzar tu mejor versión, con un plan de carrera totalmente personalizado en el que aprenderás por ti mismo y además, contarás con el apoyo del resto de compañerxs.

Tu mismo te marcarás tus propios tiempos, semestralmente hablarás con tu responsable para compartir feedback y nuevos retos, y en base a tus resultados, habrá una revisión salarial.

Somos una gran familia, desde el minuto 1 trataremos de hacerte la vida más fácil. Tanto tus compañerxs como el resto de equipo siempre tendrán una sonrisa y estarán dispuestos a ayudarte y ofrecerte todo su apoyo.

Colaborarás y trabajarás en tu día a día con grandes referentes (técnicos y/o de negocio), estarán encantados de enseñarte todo lo posible y se sentirán orgullosxs de verte crecer.

Con nosotros el Smartwork es posible. Vivirás una forma de trabajo en la que cada uno gestiona su propio tiempo.
¿Quieres trabajar 100% en remoto?¿Quieres un modelo híbrido?
En SDG podrás elegir cómo quieres trabajar, aunque creemos que es importante ponernos cara más allá de la pantalla ¡Te esperaremos en los Afterworks!

Somos una marca con propósito. Creemos que la diversidad y la inclusión ayudan a promover una cultura de creatividad, permitiéndonos superar nuevas situaciones y desafíos.

Metiéndonos un poco más en temas más formales, pero no menos importantes, ofrecemos contrato indefinido, ¡queremos que te quedes con nosotrxs mucho tiempo!, salario competitivo de acuerdo con tú nivel de formación y experiencia (no te preocupes, ya qué, en la primera entrevista, trataremos este aspecto y te informaremos si tus expectativas están alineadas) y te ofrecemos una ayuda económica para gastos ocasionados por el teletrabajo.

Podríamos continuar detallando que nos hace especiales, y nos encantará hacerlo en una llamada telefónica. Por el momento, vamos a mostrarte algunos detalles que estamos seguros que te podrán interesar ✌️

¿Cuál será tu misión? ✍

Te involucrarás en aspectos relacionados con análisis técnicos, transformación de datos y cuadros de mandos de todos proyectos en los que participes. ¿Cómo podrás hacerlo?
Aprendiendo todo lo posible a nivel técnico y, poco a poco, te haremos ganar confianza en ti mismo e irás contando con la capacidad de gestionar tu propio tiempo y cada vez trabajar con mayor autonomía.
Te encargarás también de la redacción de la documentación del proyecto en el que participes.
Participarás en el análisis funcional de los proyectos, lo que te permitirá entender el negocio y tener una visión global y mayor conocimiento de los clientes.


¿Qué te hará triunfar en esta posición? 👇

Que estés en último curso o hayas finalizado tus estudios en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Ciencia de datos, Industriales u otra salida académica que te haya dotado de capacidad de desarrollo y pensamiento crítico en este ambiente.
Valoraremos muy positivamente formación adicional en Analytics, Big Data, o alguna disciplina similar, si no cuentas con ella no te preocupes ya que ¡estamos para aprender!
Buscamos apasionadxs de los datos con espíritu innovador y muchas ganas de crecer con nosotrxs ya que podrás participar en proyectos que se mueven en entornos cambiantes en los que podrás tener un aprendizaje continuo.
Capacidad de comunicación de cara a tus compañerxs, es muy importante para nosotrxs que puedas coordinarte con ellxs, apoyarles y levantar la mano para pedir ayuda.
Cómo trabajamos en un entorno global, ¡será un plus que puedas comunicarte en inglés!

Por último, queremos contarte los pasos de nuestro proceso de selección

En nuestros procesos realizarás 3️ sesiones:

Primera toma de contacto con nuestra área de People First (donde trataremos temas de crecimiento profesional, banda salarial y definiremos qué áreas se adaptan a ti).
Segunda sesión técnica donde podrás sorprendernos con todos tus conocimientos y habilidades en entornos tecnológicos (y así poder ofrecerte un proyecto que encaje con tus conocimientos e intereses).
Reunión con el responsable del equipo en el que te incorporarías para poder solucionar todas las dudas que te hayan podido surgir en el proceso.

¿Has superado todas las fases? ¡Buenas noticias! Recibirás una llamada de People First donde te presentaremos nuestra propuesta para que te unas a nosotrxs, y poder resolverte cualquier duda que tengas al respecto. Cuando nos confirmes que quieres formar parte de la familia SDG, empezaremos a preparar todo para recibirte con mucha ilusión.

¿No te puedes incorporar ahora, pero tienes curiosidad e interés en SDG Group? No te preocupes, puedes realizar ahora el proceso de selección y te tendremos en cuenta en las próximas vacantes que encajen con tu perfil profesional.


INSCRÍBETE AHORA ¡ESTAMOS DESEANDO CONOCERTE!

job description:
About the job
HCLTech is an Indian-born global technology company helping companies reinvent their businesses for the digital age. HCL provides end-to-end services across industry verticals to leading companies, including 250 of the Fortune 500 and 650 of the Global 2000.

Our goal is to strengthen the brand in Spain. We are looking for an expert to work as Business Analyst!

Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled business analyst with a strong background in the finance sector, IT, Agile methodology and experience in robotic process automation (RPA) and business process management (BPM). The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving process improvements, implementing innovative solutions, and providing critical insights to support our strategic initiatives.

What you'll do:

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and develop operational solutions to address complex financial and IT challenges.
• Analyse and optimize business processes through the application of RPA, BPM and any other IT solution ensuring efficiency, compliance and scalability.
• Leverage Agile methodology to manage projects, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions that align with business objectives.
• Develop and maintain documentation, including process maps, user stories and functional specifications to ensure a clear understanding of requirements and solutions. Evaluate the success of implemented solutions, identifying areas for ongoing improvement and iteration.

Education level:

•University BSc. degree in finance, computer science, information systems or a related field

What do you need to know?

• 3+ years of experience as a business analyst in the finance sector, with a focus on IT and process improvement.
• Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and project management best practices.
• Exceptional analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.

What do we value?

Intermediate English language level (B1)
Proven experience with RPA and BPM tools such as UiPath, Appian, Blue Prism, Pega or similar.

Important to note:

- If you have a valid disability certificate, Certificate of Disability in Force, please contact us.

Among HCL's principles we would like to highlight diversity and inclusion as a strength in our values and practices. To achieve all our objectives, it intends to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as a key factor and differentiator of fundamental innovation in our organization. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to the inclusion and sense of belonging of each person who is part of HCL.
HCL is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Buscamos una persona con autonomía, capacidad de análisis y visión estratégica. Reportará al Director Administrativo y Financiero de España, con una fuerte relación con el Director de Control de Gestión a nivel de la División.

Allier savoir et faire

Alors que la technologie s’inscrit au cœur de la transformation numérique de nos clients, nous savons que les individus sont au cœur du succès en affaires.

Lorsque vous rejoignez CGI, vous devenez un conseiller de confiance, collaborant avec vos collègues et clients pour proposer des idées exploitables qui produisent des résultats concrets et durables. Nous appelons nos employés "membres" parce qu’ils sont actionnaires et propriétaires de CGI. Ils ont du plaisir à travailler et à grandir ensemble pour bâtir une entreprise dont nous sommes fiers. C’est notre rêve depuis 1976. Il nous a menés là où nous sommes aujourd’hui – l’une des plus importantes entreprises indépendantes de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

Chez CGI, nous reconnaissons la richesse que la diversité nous apporte. Nous aspirons à créer une culture à laquelle nous appartenons tous et collaborons avec nos clients pour créer des communautés plus inclusives. En tant qu’employeur qui prône l’égalité des chances pour tous, nous voulons donner à tous nos membres les moyens de réussir et de s’épanouir. Si vous avez besoin d’un accompagnement spécifique durant le processus de recrutement et d’intégration, veuillez nous en informer. Nous serons heureux de vous aider.

Prêt à faire partie d’une entreprise qui est gage d’excellence? Rejoignez CGI – où vos idées et vos actions changent la donne.

job description:
About the job
¿Te interesaría seguir desarrollándote como Data Analyst en una empresa líder del sector aeronáutico, con headquarters en Baracelona Ciudad?

Desde Oxigent Technologies seleccionamos un/a DATA ANALYST para participar en un proyecto de análisis, transformación y carga de datos.

¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?
-Realizar, mejorar y optimizar los procesos de ETL de diferentes fuentes de datos.
-Creación de informes y paneles digitales en TABLEAU y otras herramientas de visualización
-Identificar y crear más oportunidades de automatización y mejorar los procesos de gestión de datos
-Apoyar a otros equipos y áreas mejorando los procesos e elaboraciones de datos que permitan a otros trabajar con informes de manera efectiva.
-Creación y actualización de nuestros mapas de procesos/ datos y documentación


Para ello, ¿qué vas a necesitar?
- Experiencia previa de 2 o 3 años en posiciones similares.
- Conocimiento en herramientas como SQL, Tableau, Power BI, DAX.
- Buen nivel tanto conversación como escrito de inglés.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
- Contratación indefinida a través de Oxigent.
- Salario acorde a la experiencia aportada (entre 32.000 - 40.000 euros brutos anuales).
- Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes y los meses de verano.
- Modelo híbrido, con capacidad de hasta 80% Teletrabajo.
- Cheque Formación para desarrollarte en las áreas profesionales que más te interesen.
- Seguro médico privado.
- Retribución flexible aplicable a seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería y formación.
- Aplicación de acceso a gimnasios y actividades deportivas en toda España con descuentos.
- ¡Y muchos otros beneficios!

Securitas Direct es el líder del mercado europeo en la protección y seguridad de personas para hogares y pequeños negocios, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes con un equipo de más de 18.000 empleados, presentes en 17 países de Europa y América Latina. En Verisure Securitas Direct hemos creado las innovaciones más disruptivas del mercado, las cuales se han convertido en estándar para la industria y el sector.

HCLTech is a next-generation global technology company that helps enterprises reimagine their businesses for the digital age. Our technology products, services, and engineering are built on four decades of innovation, with a world-renowned management philosophy, a strong culture of invention and risk-taking, and a relentless focus on customer relationships. Having a worldwide network of R&D, innovation labs and delivery centers, and 222,000+ Ideapreneurs working in 60 countries, HCLTech serves leading enterprises across key industries, including 250 of the Fortune 500 and 650 of the Global 2000. job description:
About the job
Job profile

As business analyst laboratory informatics you will work within the Corporate Application Services team (CAS). The CAS department is responsible for the proper functioning and continuous improvement of all corporate business applications within Synthon. The laboratory Informatics domain covers both R&D and QC processes and consists currently of multiple applications such as LIMS and ELN. As the Synthon organization continually develops and new processes are being introduced, we expect further growth in this Lab domain in the coming years.


Key responsibilities

As business analyst laboratory informatics, you proactively identify, assess and document business requirements, recommend business priorities and advise on options, potential risks and costs. You explore possible solutions, check whether any are already being used within the company, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible. Subsequently you analyze the impact of proposed solution across the business and develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to the various stakeholders. Furthermore, your tasks will include organizing workshops, providing test scenarios, training and supporting business process experts.
You will serve as liaison between the internal customer, the external supplier and the Information Services department to manage changes according to the applicable guidelines set for the pharmaceutical industry. The position requires occasional trips to our affiliates in Europe and Latin America. The QC department has developed a paperless lab strategy and as business analyst laboratory informatics you will play a crucial role in the realization of this strategy with the introduction of LES.

You will report tot the vice president Information Services.


Our offer

We offer our employees a working environment in which trust, pride and joy play an important role and as such, we have been acknowledged as a Top Employer® in 2020, 2021 and 2022. We understand our economic, social and environmental impact on the wider world. We care - for each other, for partners, for patients and for society at large. We support various educational initiatives and actively contribute to charitable causes and to the development of the communities worldwide to which we belong.

More specifically, we offer our employees:
A professional, yet pleasant and informal working environment with short communication lines, focus on cooperation and appreciation of initiatives
Competitive remuneration
Good working conditions with attention to ergonomic support
A keen eye on work/life balance, with the option to work partly from home.

Your profile

Your letter of motivation and CV should show that you have:
At least a bachelor’s degree in (Applied) Computer Science or Business Management
A minimum of 7 years of relevant work experience in business process reengineering and business modelling concepts, business systems development and analysis (experience in the pharmaceutical or related industry is strongly desired)
Proven in-depth knowledge of laboratory informatics systems like LIMS and ELN
Thorough knowledge of managing complex projects
Experience with computer system validation is a strong advantage
An excellent command of the English language (both speaking and writing)

Requirements

In interviews, you will be able to demonstrate that:
You can easily translate customer requirements into tangible results and have proven experience as a project manager.
You are able to quickly build and maintain relationships with your colleagues, our internal customers and external suppliers.
You have strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills.
You are able to look at things from a process perspective.
You are also results-oriented, proactive and able to coordinate groups of stakeholders and activities independently.
Finally, you are flexible and still eager to learn.

job description:
About the job
¿Qué puede salir bien, cuando puedes ser TÚ, también en el trabajo? En Zurich, trabajamos cada día para que encuentres el espacio para ser quién eres. No somos perfect@s, creemos en la diversidad y apostamos por su riqueza.

Cuidar de tu bienestar es nuestra prioridad, por ello apostamos por la flexibilidad para que puedas dar lo mejor de ti, cuidando de lo que más te importa.

La sensibilidad con el medio ambiente forma parte de nuestro ADN. Podrás involucrarte con acciones reales que generan impacto para construir un planeta más sostenible.

¿Te imaginas lo épico que puede ser trabajar en una compañía que lidera el cambio ? Nosotros ya nos hemos puesto en marcha y estamos revolucionando la forma de hacer seguros. De ahí nace Klinc , nuestro seguro 100% digital que ya lo está petando.

Para construir un futuro brillante , hacen falta gestos épicos . ¿Lo hacemos?

¿Cuál será tu reto?

Tu objetivo será el de recopilar, analizar y utilizar datos relacionados con los clientes con el fin de mejorar la toma de decisiones en Zurich. Identificar tendencias, patrones y comportamientos del cliente para ayudar a desarrollar mejor la estrategia de la compañía.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Recopilación, explotación y análisis de datos de clientes provenientes de diversas fuentes para sacar conclusiones.
Ofrecer conocimientos técnicos para definir, extraer y sintetizar datos de clientes para ayudar en la toma de decisiones y la identificación de oportunidades.
Actualización y seguimiento de los dashboards de cliente. Detección de incidencias y mejoras.
Presentar los resultados de los análisis realizados adaptándolos al foro para mejorar la comprensión y toma de decisiones.
Analizar y crear puntos de vista basados en los datos disponibles y en los requisitos establecidos por otras áreas a fin de ofrecer información detallada para contribuir a mejorar el desarrollo de la estrategia.
Gestionar diversos proyectos simultáneamente para cumplir plazos acordados.
Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares de proyectos relacionados con datos de clientes para garantizar el cumplimiento normativo (compliance) y GDPR.
Impulsar la Visión Única de Cliente
Interactuar con IT y Data Governance el seguimiento y evolución del repositorio MDM (Master Data Management)
Detectar necesidades de mejora de explotación de datos de cliente.
Seguimiento, diseño y creación de KPIs de cliente.
Participación en proyectos de segmentación de clientes, de mediadores, de modelos de propensión, de cálculos de valor del cliente.

Para tener éxito en el rol sería ideal:

Grado Estadística, Matemáticas, Económicas o similar. Master relacionado con data (Big data, Inteligencia del dato, Data science), gestión o similar.
Experiencia en puestos similares de gestión del dato de clientes en los últimos 5 años.
Conocimiento de herramientas actuales de BI, Data Science, ML. (p.e. Microstrategy, Python, Power BI).
Experiencia en proyectos transversales y construcción del dato.
Habilidades de comunicación y estructuración de presentaciones con mensajes claros y con impacto.
Capacidad analítica y agilidad numérica.
Trabajo en equipo y adaptabilidad al cambio.
Visón Cliente.
Orientado a resultados.
Nivel alto de Inglés.

#PorSerDeZurich

Nos interesa tu bienestar y queremos cuidar de ti. Estos serán algunos de tus beneficios:

FlexWork: nos gusta la flexibilidad. Por ello, te ofrecemos un modelo híbrido mega flexible para trabajar cómo y dónde quieras. Te ayudamos con un bono de oficina en casa.
Tickets restaurant para que disfrutes de tus restaurantes y deliveries favoritos de lunes a domingo.
En Zurich, tu descanso es importante. Tendrás 25 días de vacaciones, y además te regalamos el día del seguro y el día de tu cumpleaños para que disfrutes de lo que más te gusta.
Retribución flexible: te ofrecemos diferentes opciones para que elijas las que más te encajan: Seguro médico, guardería, formación, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de un día de trabajo remunerado para dedicarlo al voluntariado que elijas.
Oportunidades Zurich, para que puedas moverte a otras áreas de la compañía a nivel local o internacional.
Cuidamos de tu desarrollo: tendrás más horas de e-learning que series en Netflix, plan personalizado de mentoring, formación en skills digitales, etc.
¿Quieres perfeccionar tu nivel de inglés? ¡Te ayudamos y te ofrecemos clases!
¡Asegúrate con Zurich! Tenemos muchos descuentos en productos aseguradores y ventajas bancarias.
En Zurich, pensamos en tu futuro y disponemos de plan de jubilación y seguro de vida.
Mens sana in corpore sano . ¿Eres runner o te encantaría empezar? ¡Te ofrecemos inscripciones gratis a nuestras carreras! ¿Lo tuyo es entrenar en el gym? ¡También tenemos descuentos para ti!
Referral bonus si nos recomiendas algún talento top como tú.

position: CRT Data Management and Business Analyst Specialist
job description:
About the job
Job Scope/summary

EMEA Customer Relations Team (CRT) is safeguarding the HP brand by providing the right experience for every customer at the right cost through prevention, proactive care, and differentiation. CRT acts as thevoice of the Customertodrive improvementsacrossCS and to retain customer loyaltythrough pro-active customer engagementand by providing best-in-class complaints resolution.

Within this Organization, the SETI team has the responsibility to drive innovative improvement actions to prevent complaints from happening, to enhance the portfolio of solutions available to the agents to support our customers, and to design, deploy and control the processes used by the agents, and the metrics and reports used by the organization to manage the operation.

Job Specifics/responsibilities

The responsibilities will include one or more of the following:
Create accurate reports and visualization tools
Automation and industrialization of reports
Weekly/Monthly monitoring of operations
Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly reporting of performance to the different management layer (from direct manager to CS leadership team)
Be quality oriented and critically evaluate the output of data extractions
Continuously improve data organization, automation and accuracy
Help the team turn fragmented data into Operations Intelligence that will be used to support business decisions.
Organize/ integrate data so that it can be used to support consultancy and business analysis
Structure databases which enable both high level management reports and deep dive analysis
Partner with business teams to ensure data is complete, accurate & reflects reality
Make data available on agreed timeframe in a centralized way.
Provide meaningful analysis and propose strategic business improvements
Deep-dive into processes to achieve a complete end-to-end understanding and collect/provide meaningful data
Interact with CS business analysts to understand external environmental changes and potential impacts to the performance, and provide synthesis to operations as needed
Provide narratives on performance deviation and propose corrective action plans
Run Predictive Analytics to forecast complaint volume or other key CRT metric evolution
Model the investment/saving points to use the CRT budget to support our strategy
The candidate should be detail-oriented and quickly interpret incoming information.
Key Deliverables/accountabilities
Design, deploy and maintain the infrastructure that supports CRT reporting capabilities and CRT owned tools
Design, deploy and maintain the mechanisms/processes to gather the data required by CRT
Provide the necessary reports to manage CRT operations
Provide the framework to perform the periodical reviews within the CS organization (weekly/monthly/quarterly)
Provide the framework to report and forecast accurately CRT costs
Define key performance indicators and targets to run the business
Perform deep dive analysis on volume, costs, sNPS and turnaround time
Investigate, identify and understand correlation of CRT metrics with other CS/HP team metrics
Working Relationships

Internal
Country CRT departments
EMEA and country CS department
Other HP departments involved in customer case handling (sales, etc.)
Finance and Procurement departments for tasks related to commercial solutions
External
Partners, Suppliers, Customers
Education (degree) And Professional Experience Required
University degree preferably in areas linked to Data Management, Business Administration or Engineering
7+ years of professional experience in Data Engineering and Analytics and/or Business/Finance analysis
Work experience from an international environment is an asset
Other Requirements
Excellent English, Ability to demonstrate verbal and written communication
Other European languages will be an advantage
Personal Skills And Qualities
Highly motivated in business understanding and “playing” with high volume of data
Ability to quickly and accurately organize data and transform it into visual tools and meaningful information
Detail Oriented with ability to explain the global picture
Ability to communicate across functional boundaries
Strong quality oriented, can-do attitude
Great team player, flexible, optimist!
Proactive & confident, can work largely unsupervised in a Virtual environment
Eagerness to learn and improve, good listener
Technical skills (procedures and documents the employee has to be acquainted with):
Strong expertise in SQL, ASP.NET, Power BI, Excel, VBA, IRS Reporting Studio
Skills in Data Management (Engineering) together with a strong motivation for business and financial analysis and understanding
Knowledge in RPA/Automation or in Phyton/R will be an advantage
Demonstrate knowledge of corporate organization and policies.
About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

position: Business Analyst Hybrid & Energy Storage Systems (d|m|f)
job description:
About the job
Berlin, Oranienburger Straße 17, 10178, Berlin, Germany
Frankfurt am Main, Hahnstraße 31-35, 60528, Frankfurt am Main, Germany
Freiburg, Kaiser-Joseph-Straße 263, 79098, Freiburg, Germany
Location independent
Madrid, Sagasta 31-33, planta 4, 28004, Madrid, Spain
Milano, Largo Augusto 3, 20122, Milano, Italy
München, Arabellastraße 4, 81925, Munich, Germany
Paris , 50 Ter Rue de Malte, 75011, Paris, France

BayWa r.e. is the home for change makers. We r.e.think energy – how it is produced, stored and can be best used to enable the global renewable energy transition that is essential to the future of our planet. At BayWa r.e. we effect change globally. With locations in 30 countries, we have over 4,500 people already working across the world, collaborating with local businesses to proactively shape the future of the energy sector.

BayWa r.e. Solar Projects GmbH provides an extensive range of services, from greenfield development and turnkey construction to financing options and the operation of ground-mounted or floating solar parks and hybrid plants. Thanks to our global expertise, our local teams can cater to our customers’ needs and requirements.

Due to our dynamic growth, we are expanding our Hybrid team in Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Freiburg, Madrid, Paris, Milan or in one of our many other European office locations, and are currently looking for a Business Analyst Hybrid & Energy Storage Systems (d|m|f).

What You Will Do

Modelling and evaluating business cases and their sensitivity analysis, to facilitate investment decisions and optimizing the revenue strategy
Undertaking feasibility studies on the respective energy markets and setting up revenue stacking calculation models for standalone BESS and hybrid projects (battery storage + Wind or PV)
Further developing our BayWa r.e. internal revenue models and assessment tools for Hybrid & Storage
Support the projects finance experts with insights enabling them to build up and modify financial models to fit BESS and Hybrid projects
Gathering market intelligence and monitor energy market trends that could have an impact on project valuation
Support Project Sales and PPA colleagues in negotiations with investors and route to market providers
Building the bridge between EMEA legal entities and the BESS & Hybrid expert team on corporate level as well as with the BayWa r.e. Energy Trading entity
Empowering our colleagues through workshops and trainings regarding revenue stacking modelling for BESS and hybrid projects

What You Bring

Academic degree preferably in an economic, technical, or mathematical discipline (other degrees are valued if experience matches the profile requirements)
Minimum 2-5 years working experience in the relevant business field (e.g., energy trading, PPA, energy consultancy)
Strong analytic mindset and high numerical literacy including Excel VBA and programming skills (e.g. Python, GAMS or Matlab)
Understanding of EMEA energy market designs and regulations (experience in AMER and APAC markets are a plus)
Broad understanding of BESS applications, business models and operational strategies including the valuation of them
Understanding of financial matters
Entrepreneurial and positive attitude with strong passion for the relevant business field
Experience in working with external advisors and international teams
Fluency in English (other languages esp. German, Spanish a/o French are a plus)

What We Are Ready To Offer You

Mobile working
Flexible working hours
International team (86 different nationalities working for BayWa r.e. across the globe)
Flat hierarchies, an open culture and plenty of leeway for your ideas
Modern office ambience (height-adjustable desks, additional monitors, ergonomic chairs, etc.)
Company restaurant (only in the Munich office)
Jobrad (subsidized company bike leasing)
Discounted shareholder program
Discounted fitness conditions
Discounted fueling
iPhone (also for private use)
*benefits may vary from country to country

Is This Role The Right Fit For You?

Diversity and Equal Opportunity

At BayWa r.e. we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates.

All employment is decided based on qualifications, potential, merit, and business need.

We do not discriminate on the basis of origin, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

We look forward to your application!

If you have any questions about the job offer, please get in contact with us.

Contact

Paul Schwind
HR Manager

job description:
About the job
We are the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group and we are currently undergoing a technological transformation and international expansion. In 2016 the re-launch of the Bank began and since then we have been in continuous expansion and growth, especially in our technological side. We work in a start-up format, using agile methodologies to take our clients' experience to the next level. In 2019 we launched the Bank in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal and we have landed in Argentina, with others to follow.

Our culture makes us different; social and diversity clubs are part of our essence and allow us to live our culture every day. We are a flexible and fast adapting team that currently works remotely most of the time using all kinds of communication tools, we haven´t noticed the change!

What are we looking for in this position?

Mission and responsibilities:

As a member of the Data Lake team, you will ensure the proper functioning of BigData processes of data management through monitoring tools. In addition, you will centralize the contact with different information providers in case of incident.
We want to take the digital experience of our customers to a new level and you will help us to innovate in the development of digital products in banking.:
We are looking for a person with experience in monitoring, operation and maintenance of Big Data processes typical of a Datalake.
- Daily data processing jobs built on Apache Spark.
- Daily monitoring of different data sources (> 1TB daily).
- Real-time monitoring of data flows through an operational dashboard.
- Anomaly detection and data re-entry.

Experience and Specific Knowledge:

Knowledge in data governance, as well as in AWS services: S3, EMR, CloudWatch, Lambda and Quicksigth will be an asset.
Knowledge in frameworks such as Apache Spark and programming languages such as Scala / Python, will also be positively valued.

What do we offer?

Immediate incorporation to a dynamic and agile company with a growth and expansion project.
Working in start-up mode with the support of Grupo Santander.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaboration in international projects and possibility of contact with different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events (now virtual).

Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!
Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.
If you´re not currently living in Madrid, Bilbao or Valencia and you are open to relocate, we would still love to consider your application.
